review.reviewBody: Took the shoes on a fishing trip to Baja. For the most part they were very good. They handled the notoriously slippery panga decks very well and the ventilation was also more than adequate. The one big downside for me was the lack of any kind of arch support. After the first day, I had to wear an insole, negating the waterproof feature. If you make a pair with a built-in arch support, I will buy them.
review.name: almost great

review.reviewBody: So much softer than Crocs.  The fit is better IMO as well.
review.name: Better than crocs!

review.reviewBody: I love these!  I'm a charter boat captain so I'm on the water everyday and these are my go-to.  They keep my feet as dry as possible and offer great support.  I walk 5-8 miles a day on our beaches; these shoes don't rub or cause blisters and the sand flows right on out.  I receive compliments on them daily.
review.name: Great for professional use!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for wiring big fish, grips the deck wether teak or fiberglas real good so you van get around as fast as possible, well not as fast as I used to but!!!
review.name: Working the deck on big fish is when you need the

review.reviewBody: Husband uses these on boat and said they work well.
review.name: Good boat shoes

review.reviewBody: i have a wide foot and was worried they would not be wide enough.  they fit great
review.name: very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought these abt a week ago and have had them for a day and I  already love them they are light weight and really breathable. I am at the lake a lot so I will be able to test them out a little better but for my initial though these shoes are great and affordable
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly and much safer than crocks. Won't slip on wet surfaces
review.name: Must have

review.reviewBody: Good grip, breathable and perfect fit! I love wearing this for river crossings, around camp, on route to surf and while cold dipping!
review.name: Good grip, breathable and perfect fit!

name: Riptide Sandal

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect hat for my granddaughter along with the matching jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Youth Whirlibird™ Watch Cap has quickly become a must-have for my child's outdoor adventures. Its soft and cozy material keeps them warm and comfortable without being too bulky, making it perfect for chilly days outside. Despite constant wear, the cap has proven to be durable and reliable. Its simple yet functional design ensures a snug fit and easy pairing with any outfit. Overall, the Youth Whirlibird™ Watch Cap is a versatile essential that I highly recommend for any young adventurer.
review.name: Soft and comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 11 year old son is loving this for winter soccer!  It’s is warm and comfortable without being too bulky. Fits great and doesn’t bother him while playing.
review.name: Soccer son

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect kids beanie for fall, winter and spring! My daughter loves it!
review.name: Comfortable, well made beanie for 3 seasons.

review.reviewBody: Very nice cap.  For my grandson and I think he will find this very cool
review.name: Caps the Day

review.reviewBody: The Youth Whirlibird is a nice old-school knit hat.  Please note that these don't have a fleece inner headband...just a knit hat, inside and out.  I bought a bunch of these as team hats (which we had custom embroidered) for our Youth XC Skiing program.  These are nice because they fit small kids, but also stretch enough to fit teens and most adults.  I like that they'll "grow" with our skiers better than the youth Swix and Toko hats we previously used.
review.name: Nice Little Hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This beanie is warm to the head and it’s a catch for its price.
review.name: Kids Whirlwind Beanie

description: Buy the Backcountry Cotton Gauze Short - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cotton Gauze Short - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Cotton Gauze Short - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been looking to change most of my clothes over to natural fiber so these attracted my eye since they're cotton. The fabric is nice- not see through. The rise is very high waisted which I don't love but I roll them once and the fit is better. Can't complain for paying $15. 2 pockets in the front is a nice feature. I got a size small so they run big. I'm usually a medium. I'm 5'10, 160 athletic build for reference
review.name: Nice cotton shorts

review.reviewBody: The fit on these seems to be true to size if not slightly bigger. The cut is okay, but like the pants version, the crotch is cut very long, not proportionate to the rest of the garment. The fabric is very inconsistent (I purchased multiple pairs) even within the same colorway. Some is more fluffy and some very crinkly with a different hand feel. Honestly i probably would return these if returns shipping was free, but it isn’t its 6.99. So I will keep them, but doubt I’ll buy from Backcountry again.
review.name: They are okay but could be better

review.reviewBody: I think the pants fit me better, but I ordered the pants in the medium. The shorts fit in small, but I thought I would like more room in the hips and seat. I ordered the medium, and they were huge in the waist. I think they are around  2.5 inches too big.  My waist is around 29.5. So I went back to the small, but I had already returned them, so it was a complication. I am hoping since they are cotton, they will stretch, and they do fit, just not perfectly. The fabric is lovely, and the style is attractive. Weirdly, I needed a different size in the shirt than the pants, though.
review.name: Confusing sizing.

review.reviewBody: I like these shorts, great for hot days, good price point. they do run large though, if I ordered again I'd size down a size.
review.name: Nice, airy shorts

name: Cotton Gauze Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: True to size. Easy zip on, and then can adjust to fit using the laces, so these boots don't slip while you walk! Good arch support, with strong sole and grip. Plus, it's stylish AND waterproof. Great buy.
review.name: Sorel nails this waterproof boot

review.reviewBody: Love the zipper aspect of these boots! They’re super comfy. I’d say they run a little large and a tad narrow.
review.name: Waterproof and Cute

review.reviewBody: These boots are incredible. They’re fully waterproof, so you can go trekking through rain or snow without worries of getting your feet wet. They also took no time at all to break in, within the first 30 minutes or so of wearing them they were already super comfortable. My only issue (if you can even call it that) is that the treads are a little clunky, so if you’re looking for a more feminine look, these boots might not be it. That being said, they’re pretty lightweight, and you could just as easily wear them for a walk around the mall as you could for hiking in the woods. They’ve quickly become my favorite boots!
review.name: Amazing lightweight boots!

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love these boots so comfortable as soon as I put them on! Definitely want another colour as they go with everything:) and so comfy.
Definitely also would recommend them to everyone.
review.name: Love these boots !

review.reviewBody: They don't meet your typical high quality standards. Returned.
review.name: Disappointing
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: Love these. Comfortable from the first time. Look great. Exactly what I was looking for
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I have two other colour ways in this boot. Soo comfy - i went up half a size so that i can wear a thicker sock.
review.name: Comfy boots - great purchase

review.reviewBody: 2nd pair. Very comfortable, good quality and true to size.
review.name: Excellent boot highly recommended.

review.reviewBody: I love these. They were immediately so comfortable! The zipper on the side is also such a cool feature.
review.name: I wore these to the Eras Tour and now I wear them on my motorcycle.

review.reviewBody: I initially ordered a size up due to some reviews but they were to big.  Returned and got my usual 8.5 and they fit well.  The only reason I didn't five 5 starts is they are heavier than I expected.
review.name: Explorerer Women's Lace Boots

description: Buy the Eureka! Kohana 6 Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kohana 6 Footprint
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Kohana 6 Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just got back from first trip in a bunch of rain. Footprint that included the area of the vestibules was a first for me. If any part of the vestibule is exposed to water, there’s now a path for the water to get between the footprint and your tent. That’s exactly what happens to me after a couple hours of heavy rain. 
Rain fly of Kohana6 also leaked at all 4 vestibule toggle points which exacerbated the problem but wasn’t the source. 
Anyway, first time I bought a fitted footprint and I don’t think I see the point in including the vestibules’ area.
review.name: Invites water

name: Kohana 6 Footprint

review.reviewBody: I love the shoes.  They fit well but the purple rubber covering has torn, the inner side by the side of the big toe.  The shoe also squeak when I walk.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: I walk daily - about 6km. My Guide runners have never let me down. I appreciate the built-in stability of the Guide supporting all my steps!
review.name: Happy Feet
comment: Thanks for sharing Tricia! We love happy feet!

review.reviewBody: I’ve been buying Guides since I started running over 15 yrs ago. They have been my go-to running shoe. This latest Guide 17 is so disappointing. The profile is huge and is exactly like a Hoke. Please return to making your own shoe and not copying another brand. I won’t be buying these again.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair when this version was released and I just bought my 2nd pair recently. These shoes are light weight and they have just the right amount of cushioning I need.

As I've discovered what is the opinion of many of my fellow runners, over the years many brands of running shoes change their successful models' designs simply because they feel they need to "update" them (and, often to reduce the amount of material - and consequently, cost for production - of the shoes), telling customers that the lighter shoes make for less wear on legs.  However, reducing material tends to make shoes less protective of joints/legs, which makes their being lighter irrelevant.  But the Guide 17 seems to be a compromise design between what was good in Hoke One One shoe models (like the Clifton from days of yore) and earlier Guides.  While I haven't run dozens of miles in the Guide 17 yet, so far my legs feel good!
review.name: Latest design revision is actually an IMPROVEMENT

review.reviewBody: With inserts, the support for my feet and ankles is excellent. They are super comfortable. The color turned out to be a purplish gray - not the tone I was expecting. But the price was right and it’s hard to choose a color online.
review.name: Comfy and supportive

review.reviewBody: I liked that the weight was lighter than other new models but this shoe is very bulky and I end up scraping the inside heel against the other shoe with each stride. I have switched these to my recovery shoes for shorter miles because of the bulky soles. These shoes also do amazingly on long runs (6 to 18 mi) as far as comfort and would probably make an excellent walking shoe.
review.name: Great for walking

review.reviewBody: Finally found a shoe that fits my foot, feels great and helps with my balance..
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I have worn saucony for over 20 years and this pair was different.  They hurt my feet.  Has the design for the guide changed?  I will be looking for a new type of shoe to wear.  Something is wrong with this pair
review.name: Change in design?

review.reviewBody: There were some manufacturing defects causing blister on my daughter’s feet. But saucony was great to exchange for another pairs.. we love saucony
review.name: Good running sneakers

name: Guide 17 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have been riding for a long time on narrow saddles. I decided to try wider saddles (approx. 150-155 mm). Before I tried this one, I tried another saddle, which has so far been good for me.
review.name: Returned before trying

review.reviewBody: I have a graveyard full of saddles that aren't quite right.  But this one is as close as I've been so far...  I have the non-gel version of this saddle as well.  I wouldn't have believed that the gel would add much but this saddle is pretty comfortable.  The best so far...
review.name: The best so far...

review.reviewBody: Thank goodness for this saddle.  After many years, I took up riding again and was beginning to think that I would not be able to go further than 20 miles because my lady parts got so uncomfortable. After lots of Google searching, I decided to give this saddle a try and it has saved me!  After I received it, I took a week to do many short (5-6 miles) rides to break it in and get accustomed to it, now I have built up to over 30 miles and have no pain!
review.name: Just what I needed!

name: Lady Gel Flow - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very good quality and leak proof. Nice handle easy to carry!

review.reviewBody: My daughter absolutely love it it keeps her drinks cold so while she’s playing she always has a cold drink she is excited to use it for cheerleading over the summer she is happy it’s not a leaking cup like the other Stanley

review.reviewBody: I received the 64 oz as a birthday gift and I used it everyday for a month while traveling in Japan and Philippines. I had to purchase a smaller version for everyday use and short distance travels. The water stays icy cold for 48 hours. It is easy to clean and fits in my backpack perfectly. You will get your money’s worth for this product!
review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody: I love the color and the ability to keep my water cold. But the straw is incredibly hard to open. I have to use both hands to open it because it is so stiff . i dont know if it will loosen up over time, but I'm really not pleased with the straw.
review.name: Very stiff to open

review.reviewBody: Love this cup! Especially the fact that it won’t spill. Easy to refill.
review.name: Great cup for teachers

review.reviewBody: Beautiful colors and just the right size to fit in my daughter’s bookbag!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I love this size Stanley!   It’s easy to carry and easily fits in my car drink holder.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Great cup for my teen! She wanted a cup for school that won’t leak if it gets knocked over. This was the perfect size and color.
review.name: Our 3rd Stanley purchase this year

review.reviewBody: Choose the ice flow because of the handle . I purchased this for my daughter and the handle makes for an easy transport for a clumsy child lol . She loves it . Super cute
review.name: Who doesn’t love a handle

review.reviewBody: Very light and packable, you can run this thing off a small usb battery.
review.name: Great camp light!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight camping light for tent and car camping.

overall a good inflatable LED tube light. there are magnets in it but not a lot, which makes it tough to mount well to metal surfaces.  There are tie down straps on the back which would allow you to use string or bongo ties, etc. to fasten it to something.  its literally an LED strip light that is inflatable, so it sips a power bank, isnt the brightest, but packs down small and is great for tent or pickup bed lighting off grid where weight/size matter.
These simple and compact lights work great for illuminating an area. I have a couple that I use under awning and just love the light it puts off.
review.name: Great Lights

review.reviewBody: Lasted four days of continuous use. Worked great. Used a small charger and had many more days of use. Bright and light

adjustable dim
magnets hold to tent frame in wall tent need another one for better coverage
review.name: great light for my tent

review.reviewBody: Love how it rolls up and put out an amazing amount of light and just runs off my little power bank for my cell phone.
review.name: Portable light

review.reviewBody: USB A and no battery, it’s just a short cord attached to a light.
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: The construction and comfort of the products is the high level I expect of Klymit products. The chair is not the lightest on the market but assembles easily and packs small enough to fit in my kayak hatches.  I look forward to trying the tube light "in the wild",  after I find a small USB battery this will be a perfect size for around camp.
This light bar is great, it’s light and small so it’s easy to transport and put up for camping. Lights up a bigger area than I was expecting. Definitely recommend for outdoorsy people.
review.name: Light bar

name: Everglow Light Tube

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody:
This show does it all. And does it all well. Not specific to one type or style of climbing. 
I’ve climbed 5.13 and V8 in this shoe. I’ve also run all day multi pitch 5.7. 
Comfortable, capable, and reliable. 
I’ve work this shoe for 10+ years, and plan to do so for at least the next 10.
review.name: Best all around climbing shoe in the mar

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: I saw on a website that these were the "best" for bouldering at the time, however I mainly chose them because it was on sale. I still feel fairly new though I've been bouldering for around a year; I wasn't fully aware of how different these would be in comparison to my previous pair(La Sportiva, forgot which, probably whichever is generic for beginners) as well as getting the wrong size. I should have gotten the 8.5 but I believe it's also how the shoe is built. It hurts a bit to wear for extended periods of time, however, I was told that how these shoes are. Overall, though I haven't seen too much of an improvement in my climbing though that's more my fault, I still feel these shoes are great.
review.name: Supposedly the best

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: These climbing shoes are awesome. I just wish I would’ve gotten a little bit bigger size. Apparently the European cut of shoe compared to the American cut of shoe is a little bit narrower.  I’m hoping they stretch out a little bit.
review.name: Climbing shoe

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: Great shoe for someone that actually wants to climb. Fits a bit smaller than my old five tens. Either that or it’s just more aggressive in fit than my shoes I’ve had since high school. Maybe I won’t belay in these but climbing is nice. Pick a half size up from your normal climbing shoe size.
review.name: Great intermediate to advanced shoe

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody:
The Katana Lace are my first performance pair of shoes (after my starter shoes), and they're perfect for me. Not aggressive enough to be painful to wear, but aggressive enough to give great footwork on edges and still have good slab and smearing performance. 

One unexpected benefit of these shoes is that they come off quickly, the well-designed lace system tightens up very evenly, and then releases evenly, making them every bit as fast as velcro straps to get out of. 

I'm super happy that Back Country carries my size (46, in La Sportiva shoes). Looking at you, REI. Tsk tsk.
review.name: Great all-rounders. Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: Rubber is good. Comfortable for an aggressive-ish shoe. Not comfortable enough for long multi-pitch days
review.name: Good shoes

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: sizing down is vital here. the shoe runs long. if you have wide feet, this may not be your shoe due to the shoe being so long. my climbing buddy got this shoe and he loves is but its too long for my foot and i feel like if i size down any more than my foot will be too wide to fit into the shoe.
review.name: too long

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: I’ve been using katana lace for the past three years. The new pair feels exactly the same although larger. I sized a half size down from my old katanas, but it still feels slightly larger. Probably go a full size from your old katana laces if you want them aggressive and snug.
review.name: Same shoe but larger

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of the Katana's last year based on Outdoor Gear Lab reviews. Based on the rave reviews on comfort and the fact that they did everything well with the exception of steep terrain objectives, I was sold. I have been climbing for over 30 years, and the days of sizing my shoes small to project hard stuff, all the while looking forward to taking off my shoes before completing the pitch were over. I was very happy with my original pair of Katana's, enough so that I went ahead and bought an another pair recently without reading any reviews on the redesign. I mean it was the top shoe in Outdoor's review! Well I should have read the reviews. The redesign improves the shoe in one regard and totally messes it up in another. The extra rubber in the heal does help with heel hooks. The redesign of the toe box misses the mark of what made the shoe great by affedting the comfort and/or sensitivity of the shoe. If you want to maintain the sensitivity of the previous shoe you will either have to size down at least a 1/2 and possibly a 1 full size. I went with a 1/2 size, sacrificing comfort as well as sensitivity! Message to La Sportiva. You have other models that hit the mark for steeps with the Solution, Muira VS, Skwama. Bring back the old design, otherwise I am looking for another shoe!
review.name: Dislike the redesign

review.itemreviewed: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: After my first pair of shoes wore out, I wanted to move into a more aggressive shoe. I got some Miuras and boy oh boy are those awesome. They perform like a dream. But they were miserable to wear. Way too tight for my foot. I have a wide toe box and fussy feet and these were just too uncomfortable. So I went on a quest to find something that performed well AND wouldn't make me want to abandon the sport mid-route every single climb. A friend told me these were her all time favorite shoe, so I tried them. I find they perform fabulously and they are actually comfortable enough that I don't want to immediately take them off between routes at the gym. Sometimes I just keep them on and they don't bother me. Such a good find.
review.name: Yep!

name: Katana Lace Vibram XS Edge Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very warm and waterproof. Have had them in the woods, at outdoor sporting events and on the land. Very happy with my first bogs!
review.name: Warm! Versitile!

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are fuzzy lined, I didn't realize when I ordered them. I usually wear a wide, but in bog boots they are usually ok, but I will be returning these, I wish they had a little more room
review.name: Comfortable, wish they were a little more roomy

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: these are cute and comfy but not warm at all. i went a half size up from my typical and could wear with thicker wool socks. i ended up returning due to failure to keep me decently comfortable at 65°F when they're temp rated to -13°F. annoying that even when the product doesn't perform you get charged for the return
review.name: not cozy!

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE my new Bogs. I got the pair with a lining and on my first time wearing them, they felt perfectly comfortable and very cozy. Also, they are lighter in weight than some rubber boots. I would definitely buy another pair.
review.name: Very comfortable and stylish

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered these boots in my regular size 11 and they fit great, but as I started to wear them I noticed that they were extremely stiff for a rubber boot. So stiff that they rubbed raw spots on my ankles (yes I wore socks) and the tops of my toes were so sore they were almost bruised. Bogs customer service was great and let me exchange them for a size 12... which are a little bit too big but I'll just put on thicker socks.
review.name: Great Boots, but....

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fits well, is comfortable. I like the fluffy cover at the high ankle area. I liked the color choices.
review.name: Comfy boot

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My daughter goes to college in the Upper Peninsula in Michigan. This is her 3rd pair of Boggs and she just loves them. She wears them everywhere! Easy to slip on and not too clunky to wear to class. Excellent boots!
review.name: Loves these boots!

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Like the color choices and the style. Comfortable to wear.
review.name: Good waterproof boot

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great all over comfort and design. Love wearing these in grass and wet conditions,
review.name: Great all around short boot

review.itemreviewed: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I wear an 11 wide and the 11s were perfect. However, so far these really make my feet sweat.
review.name: Comfortable, but feet sweat

name: Amanda Plush II Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
If my wife is not comfortable in her ski boots, she will not be happy, and if she is not happy, I will not be happy. Hence, although we are senior skiers, and my wife hangs out on the “magic carpet“ and at the green slopes, I realized the importance of getting her a comfortable ski boot. 

We have an Airbnb condo booked for a month this winter and will be getting senior season passes at Wolf Creek Pass ski area in Southwest Colorado.

Although the boot liner and footpad were comfortable out of the box, we had to have the calf section of the boot buckle expanded to fit her by a boot fitter here in Houston, Texas in July. After that, The boot fitter heat treated the boot to make it fit even more comfortably and my wife really likes it now. We can’t wait to see how the boots help her ski this winter as we are confident these booths will be infinitely better than rental boots.

Even if one is a much more accomplished skier than their spouse, don’t hesitate to invest in a comfortable fit for your spouse if you want to spend lots of time on the slopes together.
review.name: Most Comfortable Boot My Wife Has Ever Worn

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: Excelent Ski Boots. Very comfortable
review.name: Excelent

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: Really wanted to like this boot for my daughter. Ultimately went with the Salomon S/Pro Alpha for the narrow fit.  My daughter has a narrow 94mm foot. This boot had to be dialed all the way down and then some. This boot has a little more length inside than the Alpha. Matches the sizing charts if measuring your foot in mm. I wouldn't recommend sizing up if on the limits.
review.name: Nice boots just not for narrow feet

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: All you have to do is try on other boots first. Then, drumroll … put on this boot and you will absolutely know that you have found the best possible selection for your future on the slopes. Enjoy!!!
review.name: Best In Class

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: My husband I both work in the ski industry -- he got the Men's Supra 130's first, I watched him ski on them for 1 day (the best I've ever seen him ski) and decided I needed some of my own that day. I went with the 95's and I'm so glad I did! They're comfortable, responsive, and straight out of the box with just one heat molding, there are no hot spots or pinches anywhere. Believe the hype! Get yourself a pair!
review.name: These are FABULOUS

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: Most comfortable ski boots I've ever owned! Highly recommend them!
review.name: Salomon--Supra Boa 95

name: S/Pro Supra Boa 95 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Women's

review.reviewBody: My wife ordered this and another Castelli long sleeve jersey.  This one's a 3XL and the other one is a 2XL.  I am a 44" chest and 36" waist, sleeve length 36."  The jersey fit and sleeve length are perfect.  Versus the 2XL, this one would allow a thicker base layer and I anticipate wearing it on 40 - 50 degree days, or warmer winter days when it's windy.  Quality is the excellent high level I have come to expect from Castelli.  This jersey will now get wrapped and put under the tree and I look forward to riding in it on Dec 26.
review.name: Early Christmas Gift 2

review.reviewBody:
5'8" at 161 lbs. Bought M.  The M size fit but had a tiny bit of extra material around the armpit area. I like my jerseys snug so I returned it. Usually, I buy Castelli jerseys with "Fit: form-fitting" in size M. 
But the description for this jersey says "Fit: comfortable". This description is accurate. If I was looking for a "comfortable fit", this jersey would be a good option.
review.name: Comfortable fit

name: Entrata Thermal Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
This is my third Giordana jersey. They always have a shorter than usual fit, lengthwise. I'm 



I'm 5'9, 145lbs. I usually wear a medium but this jersey is not race fit so I returned the medium for a small. Sleeves don't hug, shoulders don't grasp, and there's a little room in the mid section. None of this is bad but just be aware. Other than that I love the jersey. Nice to not be cramped in sometimes.
review.name: Room

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight jersey. Breathes very well. Being a heavy sweater, I appreciate that it does not hold a lot sweat making the jersey heavy. Fits very snug which I prefer. So far so good.
review.name: Great Summer Jersey

hasVariant.name: Rubber Tech Tips
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Rubber Tech Tips online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These Tech Tip rubber tips are a huge improvement over the rubber caps that I had previously used (and which constantly fell off). I purchased them for a multi-day trek on the Alta Via Uno in the Dolomites and hiked across all types of terrain, from dirt to rock to creek to snow, and these tips held up great!
review.name: Great option for hiking!

review.reviewBody: Simple to install. Made of a very hard rubber thus they will last!
review.name: Easy to install

review.reviewBody: The tips are well made and easy to change. I wish they lasted longer and that I didn't have to pay a shipping fee the was slightly lest than the cost of the tips.
review.name: Short Life

review.reviewBody:
Love the Icon 700 Headlamp! 
Hiking in and out of the woods in the dark was more like a daytime walk! 
Comfortable and the beam is directional which is what I was looking for.
review.name: Love the Icon 700 Headlamp!

review.reviewBody:
Great product, I don’t have a lot to say except it has met me needs.
Easy to use, easy to install.
review.name: Tips

review.reviewBody: I'm using my poles in the Hollywood Hills. The rubber tips I had were heavy and hard to remove. The rubber tips screw in just like the tips for hiking on dirt and are just as light. They are worth the cost and shipping as stores in LA don't carry them.
review.name: Using My Pursuit Shock Trekking Poles on Streets

review.reviewBody: Great, work well, & good traction: easy to put on & service to-get them was efficient Reasonable price, so worth it!
review.name: Tips for trekking pokes

review.reviewBody: These fit on my older Trail Back poles. Only complaint is the Flex Tips only come in metal and I had to purchase the rubber tips separately costing me more.
review.name: Good but limited option

review.reviewBody: I was hoping they fit well, stayed locked in, and were quieter on hard terrain than the carbon tip default ones.  They met every single expectation!!
review.name: Perfect fit and much quieter than the carbon tops!!

review.reviewBody: Silenced the trek poles in rocky terrain...that's what I wanted them to do, and they worked flawlessly.  See well made and durable, happy with purchase.

name: Rubber Tech Tips

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Express Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I would not recommend this helmet. Bought for my daughter two months ago. Brim and inside padding do not stay in place. They are constantly slipping down over her face despite the helmet being the correct size. Velcro is hardly functional. Really poor performance for price.
review.name: Faulty

review.reviewBody: I was wearing this helmet when I flew off my electric scooter going 20 miles an hour. My head in my helmet broke the fall and then I hit my shoulder hard enough to dislocate it and tear my rotator cuff. Thank you smith for keeping my head safe! Not even a mild concussion!
review.name: Saved my noggin

review.reviewBody: I commute in NYC to work everyday on a bike and my husband (thankfully) made me get a helmet. I thought this was a perfect mix of function+aesthetic+value. I had no idea it would actually save my life. A truck took a left turn directly into me, and my head hit the ground so hard I broke 2 teeth and busted my lip. But I didn’t even suffer a concussion or lose consciousness- this helmet did its job. Highly recommend.
review.name: Actually saved my life

review.reviewBody: Les couleurs sont belles et éclatantes. Le style est différent des autres et j’aime ça. La lumière derrière le casque est un plus pour moi. J’adore.
review.name: Génial

review.reviewBody: Love the quality of the helmet, it fits great, and has excellent coverage, it also looks good too.
review.name: Love the quality of the

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet after my brother bought one as well. We both have a large oval heads and Smith helmets fit nicely. Tried at least 5 other companies' helmets, but Smith beat them all for fit, comfort and looks. Plus, they are not overloaded with Vent holes. The light and visor are a nice bonus as well.
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: The helmet fits well and I love the bright color yellow. I liked the light, but alas it fell out after about a week of owning the helmet. I don't think I'll buy a replacement light because there is not latch or anything to keep it from falling out.
review.name: Love the color and fit, light fell out

review.reviewBody: Want to love this helmet but several features are unreliable. I use it to commute several days a week and every time I use it, I have to reattach the Velcro that holds the visor on. Some padding has fallen off, leaving exposed Velcro that ruins hats and hairdos. The light has fallen out so many times I’ve lost it. Most annoying is the chin strap. The tension on the adjustment is not sufficient, so I have to tighten it before each use. Overall could have been a great helmet but the hardware is seriously lacking.
review.name: Hardware is lacking

review.reviewBody: I just received this helmet this morning and went out for a test ride soon after. Very pleased with this helmet! It has everything I want in a helmet. Integral rear light (I usually have to add my own) and a great removable cloth (as in cap-style) visor. I don't use a visor in the summer but when the sun is lower in the sky it really comes in handy! I use a light on all my helmets all the time. So I'll see if this helmet is 'venty' enough for summer rides. Otherwise 3 seasons is also great. Love this helmet!
review.name: Great Helmet!

review.reviewBody:
Bon achat. J'ai acheté pour le modèle pour la qualité du produit mais aussi pour la lumière arrière qui me procure un sentiment de sécurité. Seul petit bémol avec mon achat, le prix du shipping, j'ai trouvé un peu cher !

Mais sinon, très contente de mon achat !
review.name: Bon achat

name: Express Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Crank Brothers Mallet Trail Pedal online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mallet Trail Pedal
hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Mallet Trail Pedal online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: You're paying for the color of these. Not sure if all crank brothers pedals are this terrible, as I've previously ran SPD, but good lord these are bad. Even commuting, having the pedal weighted and turning your body to look for traffic will un clip these. Engaging is incredibly unintuitive, again, maybe because I've only ran spd prior, but these require 'target acquisition' and then an extra stomp to get the cleat into the pedal. I'm sure it'd ease up over time, but the retention is already so terrible I can't imagine that spring loosening up being a good thing. $180 well wasted. Even if you're just commuting in these, save your money and buy some nice flats, and wear whatever shoe you want. I've got some new Look SPD style pedals coming in the next few days.
review.name: Race face flats have more retention

name: Mallet Trail Pedal

review.reviewBody: Something about this boot that gets my day heading out the door!
review.name: Happy boot

review.reviewBody: These boots fit well as far as sizing goes, I ordered a size 12 & they aren’t too big or too small. They’re durable & have solid support although as another review pointed out - the heel of this boot tends to rub up against the back of your foot & after prolonged hours, it will become sore & noticeable. Thicker socks fixes this. Also, in reference to the review which stated the quality was low & a hole appeared shortly after purchasing them, I suggest they not wear them so tightly for I’ve fully broken mine in all sorts of weather & every part of the boot is still intact. Would recommend.
review.name: 4.5* | Would Recommend

review.reviewBody: I've had this boot for many years.  They show a bit of normal wear and tear but they are still waterproof and very comfortable.  Use them during the winter for snow removal and recently for bird watching in wet, muddy conditions.  If you want to high performance boot at a reasonable price, this it the one.
review.name: Good fit and great performance

review.reviewBody: The hole between the rubber and the leather appears on day 6. My feet were wet.
review.name: Bad quality
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: The back heal is a hard rubber so you’re rubbing against that and will get blisters. Prefer a softer heal like running shoes or most other sorrels. Had to return.
review.name: Uncomfortable
comment: Hello, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Men's Ankeny™ II Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

name: Ankeny II WP Boot - Men's

description: Buy the SeaSucker Talon Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Talon Bike Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the SeaSucker Talon Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are in fact game changing for me. This rack is inexpensive, rock solid once mounted and very versatile as far as placement. Can easily be swapped between just about any vehicle with a flat surface you can think of. Can be mounted on back glass of SUV or car and of course any roof with a flat surface. I watched an instruction video and had mine mounted the first time in under 3 minutes. It was so easy, I was second guessing myself that I had something wrong. Removal is under a minute. Each suction cup holds 200 lbs so combined you have 600lbs of holding force. 
By far the greatest pros are the ease of installation, ability to easily remove and use on another vehicle and price. 
Axle/skewer is sold separately by the way so please make note of that when ordering.
review.name: Game Changing Mount

review.reviewBody: Initial impression is that it works just as expected on my car. However, I find it very annoying that no adapters are included for the front mount. The adapter is a small plastic component used to fit either a quick release or different thru-axle sizes. Without it, the Seasucker can't be used... yet none are included. Each adapter must be separately purchased for $20 (yes, the price is very inflated for a piece of plastic). Seasucker should *at least* make it more clear that no adapter is included. I thought the thru-axle one was at least included and was surprised to open the box and find none. Ideally, Seasucker would just include one of each adapter, or offer the option to choose one to include.
review.name: Works great, but should include adapter

review.reviewBody:
The pictures and description indicate the 9mm QR mount is included. This was not the case for the product that was shipped to me, so expect to spend additional money to get that and add it to your cart so you don't have to wait another few days to arrive before being able to use your rack.

Otherwise, the product itself is fine. Do your research and make sure it fits your needs, but I can move this between any of my vehicles and, combined with my trunk rack, I can carry all of my family's bikes at once since the kids' bikes no longer fit inside the car ;)
review.name: Mount not included

review.reviewBody:
We have both two of these singles and a double version for travel. But the singles are the best bet, take one for each bike. Haven’t seen a rental car they don’t fit and they work great. Two of these go in our  bike equipment duffel and on the plane it goes with checked in with our bike cases. 

They work great. Had them up to 75mph with no issues. Each suction cup has 210lbs of “suck” or 630 for the whole rack. You’d tear the roof off before they let go. H
review.name: THE answer for rental cars

name: Talon Bike Rack

review.reviewBody:
I wore these almost every day this past winter and spring. Waterproof upper, grippy chunky lugged outsole, and smushy cushioning typical for On shoes all add up to make these do-it-all foot garages my go-to this past winter and fall.

These would be great as a dedicated low-top hiker, a work shoe if you need waterproofing and the grip on uneven surfaces, or just as a casual option.

You can make waterproof material only so breathable, so my dogs start to bark if I wear these in warmer weather. They'll be chilling in my closet for a couple months unless I decide to get up to some high alpine silliness this summer.

These fit true to size. They do favor a higher-volume foot, so not the best option for those with flat, low volume clompers.
review.name: Comfy Shoe for All Conditions

name: Cloudhorizon Waterproof Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Fold N Go 2-Burner Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Fold N Go 2-Burner Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Nice and compact but totally worthless in a breeze. I made some circular windscreens for it which improved performance immensely. Wrote to Coleman to describe my efforts with pictures and received zero response.
Guess they weren't interested.
review.name: Fold N Go worthless without a windscreen.
comment:
Hello, 

Thank you for leaving the review on our Fold N Go™ Stove. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, please reach out to us via https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time.

Thank you and please stay safe!
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Size matters and in this case it was the deciding factor. I wanted something a little bigger than one of my backpacking stoves and smaller than the traditional two burner stoves. I’m using it for car camping trips on a long weekend. It’s has worked great so far. I can cook breakfast on one burner and boiler water for coffee on the other. Later in the day I can fire up the kettle for a spot of tea and set the eye on heat to fry a steak very fast and very delicious. Does a bang up job at less than a third of the price the competitors want to charge.
review.name: Tight places

review.reviewBody: Nice stove but some compromises. The stove is super easy to setup and light. The stove is stable and powerful enough it folds up easily but it is a litt fiddly to position the tube assembly inside to close up completely. The main compromise is that the stove has almost no wind protection and was slow to cook in the wind. To its credit it stayed alight and made my cup of tea but it was slower. I normally use the Colman dual fuel two burner stoves which have excellent wind protection but they are difficult for my friend to use with arthritic hands.
review.name: Nice product not for hArsh conditions

review.reviewBody: Best grill I ever had. Still works like new over fifteen years later. Very portable. Easy to set up and take down. Cleaning is also a breeze too.
review.name: Best grill ever

review.reviewBody: We have owned our Fold N Go for almost 10 years now and it still works like a charm.  No better camp stove for the money.  We get a lot of power outages where I live and we use it to boil water for tea, coffee, & Raman.  Just the other evening, during a power outage we made Tomato Soup and Grilled Cheese Sandwiches for 8 on it.  A single 1lb tank of propane seems to last days, so very efficient.  If I had any recommendation to make it better it would to make the burner controls a bit more sensitive as it is an acquired skill to be able to get it to produce a low flame without turning off.
review.name: Affordable, Durable and Supremely Functional

review.reviewBody: Best little cook stove ever!  Compact, easy to use and clean. A must have for all campers.
review.name: #1 cook stove

review.reviewBody: Stores nice and works well.  This little stove is great, one thing make sure to have a little wind block if windy, just to keep the flame directly under the pot/griddle.
review.name: So easy to set up and use

review.reviewBody: The latch that holds the two halves together will not stay secured.   The grates are too high off of the flame.
review.name: latch issue

review.reviewBody:
I got this stove for my birthday,  took it camping and had nothing but issues with it . First it would not work at all, could not light it at all  then the flames were so high could  not turn it down at all so we lost all the propane . Something is. Very wrong with this unit itself .
The park ranger had to come and put this u it out for us , told us it is a fire hazard and to get rid of it or someone could be harmed in our camping group . 
So we took the u it and the parks people threw it out for us as who wants to use a defected cook stove . So now we are without a stove , great birthday gift not . Watch out for this stove .
review.name: Not what it seems to be
comment:
Hi there. 

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and taking the time to provide a rating on our Perfect Flow Fold N Go Stove. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We’re sorry to hear that the quality of this stove didn’t meet your expectations. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services.

If you have any questions or would like to obtain warranty service, please visit Coleman website, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, choose to contact us and you will be routed to our contact form.


Please let us know if you need further assistance. Thank you and have a great day!

review.reviewBody: Doesn’t work well at all need to talk to customer service about return. Only one side works and the one that works burns funny doesn’t seem safe at all.
review.name: Bad decision
comment:
Hello!

Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear that the stove does not work properly and that you believe it is unsafe. We take pride in providing quality service to our customers and apologize for falling short in this area. Your feedback is instrumental in helping us improve our services.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

name: Fold N Go 2-Burner Stove

review.reviewBody: I'm headed for a motorcycle trip across Italy and need an easy way to secure helmets and jackets to the bike so we don't have to lug them around with us when we stop. This Abus Combiloop 205 appears to be just right for that purpose. I've yet to field-tested it so I can't simply give it 5 stars yet; but it's obviously a quality product and I believe I will do well as a deterrent-level security device. It is among several items I've now bought from Motorsport for our upcoming trip, and the've been easy and prompt to work with. Plus I had a hard time finding this Abus Combiloop 205 elsewhere, so I am grateful Motorsport had it in stock.
review.name: Exactly What I was Looking For

name: Combi-loop 202 Lock

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I used to love these boots but not anymore... After less than 1 year of use the toe welt at the front is completely destroyed. Because of that the crampons can't be securely attached anymore. The crampon welt at the back is perfectly fine (because it's plastic) while the one at the front doesn't exist anymore.

I lost my crampon twice last week on a very steep north face. Consequences could have been catastrophic.
I'm not the only person with that problem. Another climber in my group has the exact same issue.
A quick search on the internet shows that other people have the same issue but still... it has never been fixed...

Is it a strategy to sell more boots ? Or to save weight ?
It seems like La Sportiva doesn't care at all about safety as long as they can sell boots...
That's unacceptable for such expensive mountaineering boots and even more unacceptable when it has an impact of our safety.

I won't buy this boots anymore unless they fix it with a decent plastic welt at the front (like all the other brands do).
I'll go with their concurrent brand for my next pair of shoes. Maybe not as comfortable for the size of my feet but at least I won't die using them.
review.name: Dangerous boots... Don't buy

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use it for Mount Baldy in California 10,064' I had symptoms of hypothermia, my feet went numb for three months, I tried double sox and it didn't solve the problem. I still use it but with warmers. I don't know if it's the model or just that one came out defective
review.name: Not good.

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this boot for ice climbing in New Hampshire. I've been out four times now in temps down to the single digits (F). 
Finnish: The first thing you notice when unboxing these is, well, how nice looking they are. The "look" like the build quality is exceptional. 
Weight: Size 43 (US 10) each boot weighs exactly 1000g. 
Fit: The fit right out of the box is fantastic. The sizing seems to be spot on with all my other shoes. (US 10, EUR 43). My feet are a little wider than average and I often have compression at the widest part of my foot. Not with these, these fit perfect. I'm not sure how these will fit a narrow foot so be advised to check that if your feet are narrow. As mentioned in other reviews, the lacing system is simple and functional. The locking eyelets allow differential tightening between the top and lower part of the boot. 
Crampon fit: Grivel Rambo 4 crampons fit perfectly.
Steep ice. Great support on steep ice. 
Hiking: The stiff insole that make these great for vertical ice makes these relatively stiff and inflexible for hiking. For approaches on snow they are fine but I'd look for something else for longer hikes that don't involve steep climbing. 
Warmth: My feet get cold. I have some toe nerve damage from many years of  playing outside in the winter. I have used these standing on ice for 6 hours in air temps in the teens. I've done a couple hikes in temps in the single digits. I do have to put a chemical toe warmer in the toe of the boot but with that my feet have been comfortable in those conditions. The G5 Evo's are probably warmer but these work for what I want. 
I am very impressed and happy with these boots for what I need (winter ice climbing in temps down to low teens (F). I recommend these for this purpose and would buy again.
review.name: Great boot for cold winter ice climbing.

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are made for ultimate performance, but unfortunately runs too narrow. I even went size up for these but still too narrow.
review.name: Runs too Narrow.

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The quality doesn’t disappoint. They feel comfortable and warm. Sizing is mostly accurate when one leaves thinks of extra space for thick socks and crampons. The inner sole has an arch that may feel awkward until one gets used to it. Lacing is complex as provided laces are short. Bots this heavy require double knots to firmly keep the laces tight. Leather is beautiful and I enjoy the colours. Overall, an excellent warm alpine boot. My last Sportivas lasted 10 years of heavy use and abuse.
review.name: Weather Proof

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have half a season in these and the impression so far is very positive. The boots are comfortable, no issues with breaking them in, no awkward spots or pressure anywhere. The lacing system let's you dial in fit. Having the little rings lock of the lower half of the boot is quite nice and as long as you double knot the upper section stay tight as well. At lower temps (lower teens) I started to feel a bit cold, especially when belaying, but this is manageable with a double sock or just something thicker. One area which I think could be improved is the amount of space on the crampon lip, it could be a bit deeper. In deeper powder this did not disappoint, absolutely no snow got inside. For sizing I went with a 44 (I'm typically a US 10 in street shoes), and that gave ample room for the foot to move when using crampons without feeling loose in the heel.
review.name: First Impressions

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Honestly thought they would be warmer in the harsh conditions
review.name: Great boot!

review.itemreviewed: Nepal Cube GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are the warmest I’ve been able to find. Also comfortable enough for long hikes in deep snow. Sizing was very accurate. Great overall product.
review.name: Warmth

review.reviewBody: Ignore the sizing chart.  I wear an 8.5 - 9 shoe and the chart showed L/XL was my size with a range of 7-11.  Nowhere close to getting them on, much less zipping the back.  Ordered XXL and they fit nicely.  Otherwise good quality and warm for days in the 40s and below.
review.name: Runs really small

review.reviewBody: They are warm, have great construction and look like they will be very durable. They fit snug around the shoe and was able to slip them in without much trouble. However, I was not even able to zip them all the way up because they are extremely narrow at the top. For reference, I wear a 38 in European size and I'm petite built.
review.name: Run small and narrow.

review.reviewBody:
The Good:  
  These were a Christmas gift.  I used once in 32*F dry & sunny conditions and my feet stayed warm on a 4 hour ride.

The Bad:
  These are extremely undersized.  I wear size 10.5 dress, 11.5 -12 hiking / trail running shoes.  I purchased XXL.  They stretched enough to wear, but will likely tear as a result.

attached pic is adjacent to size 11.5 running shoe
review.name: Warm, but runs very small

review.reviewBody: Got these for Christmas and love them. Keep my feet warm and dry on these cold and sometimes damp days of winter riding.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: These run a tad small in my opinion. They however are fantastic at keeping your feet warm and dry!  These are definitely a keeper and spreading the word!
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: These are perfect for riding in temperatures in the 30s and 40s F (and high 20s windchill). Paired with wool socks, my usually extremely cold toes only feel a slight chill at the lower temperature end. They may resist a little water, but I've found them to be mostly absorbent of water. I rode them in rainy conditions in the mid 40s and the first puddle I rode through saturated them. Nonetheless, my completely soggy feet did stay warm for the rest of the rainy ride. I've also noticed a slight dampness from riding through a puddle or two, and they won't dry out on their own without placing them on my PEET dryer overnight. I bought the S/M and can fit them on my EU40 and EU41 (barely) shoes.
review.name: Warm, sturdy, absorbent

review.reviewBody:
I try to ride my bike all year, even if in the winter I am doing hills on the road. Unfortunately once my toes started to go numb and freeze I had to stop. These shoe-covers solved that issue for me. 

My feet never felt cold, I do clipless and had no issues with the covers and clipping in and out. 

I even crashed and they were durable and I just slipped them back on. I have had water splash on my feet and they still kept them dry and allowed me to keep riding without any discomfort in my feet from the elements. 

I purchased SIZE : L/XL - I wear a size 10.5 and it wrapped nice and tight around my mtb shoes
review.name: Your feet will thank you

review.reviewBody: I would wear these at about 55-60deg and below but my feet are always about 10 deg colder than the rest of my body and are chronically cold. At the higher end of this range I notice that my sweat is getting trapped some in the boot and as I take them off it's a little wet. With that said I don't think the moisture has caused me any problems or made my feet any colder.  I have a size 46 shoe and the L/XL fit great.  At 30deg my feet still went numb but it was a huge improvement over anything else I've tried.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Big improvement for cold feet

review.reviewBody: These are great for those cold and windy mornings. They keep my toes nice and warm, while the rest of my body is freezing. Highly recommend them for those 55F and below days... maybe even 60F.
review.name: Fantastic covers - saved my toes

review.reviewBody: I use this shoe cover for my road bike ride on the 50s degree. It is perfect to keep my feet warm but my feet will be sweating after a 40 mile ride. Very easy to put them on and off but just to make sure wear them first before your shoe.
review.name: Love this shoecover

name: Diluvio Ul Shoecover

review.reviewBody: The wind protected chest is a great idea and works really well on the bike or skis!
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody:
As usual, 7MESH delivers a high-quality product with thoughtful details that makes it my favorite cool weather jersey. The lightweight wind resistant front and arms take the chill off the breeze, while the back half is super lightweight and wicks easily. 

Pairs easily with a baselayer for colder temps, and the bike-specific cut is just right with plenty of room to move without extra material flapping in the breeze as you ride. 

Would absolutely recommend and would buy another in a different color. 

6'2" 165 and M fits be perfectly.
review.name: Perfect for shoulder season riding

review.reviewBody: Used for work and running and didn’t have any foot pain. Very good looking
review.name: Great shoes, used them all day and no foot pain

review.reviewBody: Runs a little big. I bought an 8 as that’s what wear in other adidas shoes. Should have gone 7.5.
review.name: Cute and practical!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great! Received these just before an unexpected snow fall & wore them to negotiate snow & slush - kept my feet dry & my grip secure. Love them
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice look.  The color contrasts stand out nicely. Versatile.
review.name: Eye catching shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and gore tex technology & black colour scheme makes it great to run in the rain and through the puddles without worrying about ruining the shoes.
review.name: Great cold/ wet weather running shoes

review.reviewBody: Really nice shoes and comfortable after the first day, they just need to be broken in.
review.name: Great shoes, comfortable after you break them in

review.reviewBody: I really tried to wait until these were on sale but after wearing them for a few weeks I’m glad I didn’t . I stand up at my job for hours and these hold up pretty well for that type of activity . They are indeed good to wear in the rain as well but there is some room even though this is my normal shoe size . I would say size down if you can with thinner socks and if not just wear thicker socks because  they are a bit bulky .
review.name: The price is justified

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lighter than expected, super comfortable, great in rain
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved this product ; very comfortable for walking . It is also waterproof, which means my socks won’t get wet when it rains .
review.name: Perfect shoes . Must have it !

review.reviewBody: These shoes are amazing. Comfy, stylish, plenty of bounce and most of all completely waterproof!
review.name: Dry Feet!!

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Usually hoka shoes have far too narrow of a toe box but there are perfect. Roomy without being sloppy. They do run a little warm is my only gripe.
review.name: Finally a Hoka that fits me

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I stopped buying the Hoka trail shoes because they were too heavy. I just bought the regular road shoes for years. Then I found these and they are light and yet stable enough. I love them for the trails.
review.name: my favorite of all my Hokas

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: For someone who suffers from plantar fasciitis the both pair of Hoka that I bought have turned my everyday pain into something non existent. The recovery and comfort is second to none.
review.name: Outstanding Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really wanted to love this shoe. It's super light and comfy midsole on rough terrain which I normally run on. Wanted to use this shoe for ultramarathon racing, but alas, the narrow and pointed shape in the front of the shoes cause my outer toes to jam constantly against the shoe and was painful after just 13 miles of trail running. I tried sizing up, but the issue persisted. If you have pointed feet, they'll work great, but normal feet that splay and flex as you run just won't work with this shoe. Had to return them.
review.name: Comfortable and painful

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is an early review. This is a good but not great shoe for my purposes: running/hiking/scrambling in the Wasatch over ~6-12 mile distances. The design, materials, and assembly are great. The Mafate fits my foot very well. It looks rad, too. The Hoka policy permitting/encouraging 30-60 days of use is fantastic, enabling a true assessment. I dislike the Mafate footbed. It feels subtly concave under foot. Presumably, this will resolve as my foot pounds down the foam. But it's definitely a subtle annoyance. Comparatively, the Speedgoats feels flat under foot, which I prefer. Additionally, I don't notice a benefit from the Mafate's two layers of foam versus the Speedgoats one layer. Maybe I would notice if I did ultra distances. But that's not my jam. I see why people love this shoe. And it's really good, but maybe not the best for my purposes. Time will tell.
review.name: Quite nice, but

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Best trail running shoes I have worn so far. Very comfortable and lightweight.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my go to shoe for CrossFit. Great for rope climbing, lifting and good support for running.
review.name: CrossFit crosstrainer

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had struggles finding a suitable shoe for long mountain/trail (Colorado) runs (4hrs+). The shoes I've tried for this application that haven't worked for a variety of reasons include: Saucony Xodus Ultra 1 and 2, Hoka Speedgoat 5, Merrell Agility Peak 5, and Topo Athletic Ultraventure 2. I have put about 60 miles on these Mafate 4s on and off trail in the mountains, and they are proving to be superb. The fit and lockdown is miles above the SG5, in my experience. Upper seemed to drain water effectively. The midsole is comfortable and a near perfect balance of cushion and response. I just did a 30mi segment of the Hardrock course in the San Juan mountains, rugged and rocky, and my feet were comfortable throughout a long and tough day on trail. The outsole is the best I've ever used- the Vibram Lite Base as well as the lug design create a very secure traction, felt solid on wet rocks (Saucony's great fail-point). I woudn't say these are a lightweight shoe, yet they felt nimble enough in technical terrain and did not feel cumbersome. If Hoka would lose the debris funnel--the heel swallow tail--which does necessitate the use of a gaiter in many outings, they would really have a dream trail shoe
review.name: New Favorite Mountain Ultra Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe. Upper is superb, great fit. Midsole is responsive and cushy. Love the padded tongue. Great traction. Reminds me of the Evo Speedgoat and the 2 and 3 versions of the Speedgoat.
review.name: Awesome shoe!!!

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I appreciate being able to order a few pairs, compare the fit, comfort, and appearance. Making a decision and sending the others back is a great experience. Thank you.
review.name: Perfect fit, looks great too!

name: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

I don’t know about anyone else, but me? I have certain clothing items that are perfect, my favorites & this makes the cut. Holy cow it feels like I ordered it and the next time I opened my door there it was, talk about expedited shipping at no extra cost🤩. This is my first order, you will see this review on every item I purchased and I will be buying from

review.reviewBody: Love the soft fabric and modern cut of this shirt! It's a great layer for yoga or casual wear, with the short crop in front and drape in the back. Works well with leggings, bike shorts, or any high rise bottoms. The fit is loose, but that makes it work well for summer weather. I'm pretty tiny on top (32A) and have plenty of room in XS.
review.name: Great light summer casual or workout top

review.reviewBody: A small is huge. I will return the shirt.
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: I really went back and forth on this shirt, I like all of it minus the boxy neckline. The shoulder straps sit kind of wide on my shoulders, but I do like how the shirt if flowy and the crop isn't too aggressive so decided to keep it, planning on pairing this with the Backcountry Kamas corduroy short for beach and camp days this summer.
review.name: Boxy fit at the neckline

review.reviewBody: So I bought these to take with me to Istanbul since they were flat and matched with everything. But I wasn’t prepared for how comfy they would be!!! No break in, they’re so cute, and easy to put on. I will say I found them to run *slightly* small but I didn’t have the time to exchange and everything ended up fine. Would def recommend!!!
review.name: The most comfortable sandals I own

review.reviewBody: These shoes seemed to run small. My heel was extended past the back of the shoe. They seemed nice otherwise.
review.name: A Bit Small
comment: Hello Shelli, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Ella™ II Slingback Sandal is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I own 3 pairs of these now! Black, gold, and this newest metallic pair. They are some of the only shoes I have been able to put in and wear all day without developing blisters. They are super comfortable.
review.name: Third pair!

review.reviewBody:
Pretty shoe but not for hi instep
Stiff leather not the usual cquality of I love my Sorel back they went

comment: Hello AB, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Evolv Zenist Pro LV Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe to exclusively climb indoors. I went up 0.5 EU size (42 EU -> 42.5 EU) and fit was snug but not painful, and heel fit was perfect. The velcro & lace hybrid system felt better than normal velcro from me coming from a Drago LV. It is slightly stiffer than Drago LV but still competent for indoor volume smearing. Toe patch works wonders for toe hooking and heel hooking was great as well. Highly recommend this shoe if you are looking for a excellent indoor bouldering shoe.
review.name: Excellent indoor bouldering shoe

review.reviewBody: Read the two reviews below then take a deep breath and THINK.  Why would Backcountry send either of these people a replacement size without getting paid, in the hopes that the person will be a good boy and actually send in the return in pristine, re-salable condition?  In reality, people are more likely to try and game a good faith exchange algorithm than reciprocate the good faith.  Ever look at the 2nd hand box in a certain other outdoor retailer? Smart alecs wear climbing shoes to death, then return them for full credit on an exchange for a new pair.  Kinda like putting your skiis between two trees at the end of the season, to break them and activate the warranty.  Nope: The right way is to order two sizes and send back the size you don't prefer.  Some people's entitled narcissism is utterly laughable.  I've patronized Backcountry for years and spent THOUSANDS with them; and have never had anything less than EXCELLENT customer service.
review.name: Are You Two Kidding?

review.reviewBody: Same experience as them person that left the first review. Wrong size sent. Desired size not in stock. Have to package and send back the item and wait a week for a refund. Waste of time. I wish I read the first review before purchasing the item. Won't be shopping with Backcountry again.
review.name: Wrong size

review.reviewBody:
I was sent the wrong size in this shoe so I am unable to fit them on my feet or give them a proper review. I was told by the “experts” in the chat that these were listed in men’s sizing, they are actually listed in women’s sizing. Now Backcountry does not have my size in these shoes or any of the other shoes that I would like for an exchange. So I will be trying the regular volume versions of this shoe in a half size down. I don’t have any hope that the shoe will fit me. 
Returns are also a Joke with Backcountry. You have to literally pay for the item a second time to start an exchange, and then hope you will get a refund in a few weeks. Overall, my experience here has been pretty much a joke. 
I would recommend purchasing from elsewhere.
review.name: Wrong size Arrived.

name: Zenist Pro LV Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Equipe R Habu S9 Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Perfect jacket for mid to high 30s into the high 40s, even with rain.  It’s windproof and almost waterproof.  The fit is great and disappears on the bike.

The best part of Assos jackets and jerseys are the pockets.  They are in the right place and they are big enough to store extra gloves, a shell jacket, your phone, and food.  I also have Rapha jackets and while the fabrics and cut is nice, the pockets are all wrong—they are too short and/or too high which makes them harder to use.
review.name: Does Exactly What It’s Supposed TO

review.itemreviewed: Equipe R Habu S9 Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a closest full of Assos Jackets going back over a decade of riding. Of all the jackets I have, the Habu is my favorite. It fits great. The fabric is some of the best Assos has ever designed.  And the feel is luxurious. Exactly what you would expect from Assos. The Johdah is great for sub-freezing early morning riding in the mountains of Utah when you need the most insulation. The Habu is for everything else. When the temperatures dipped in the 30s, this is the jacket I grabbed all winter this past year. On an early March ride I crashed, rolled and tore my shoulder, but the Habu wasn't damaged.  If you need a versatile jacket that you can pair with various base layers to get you through rides from November through April, pick the Habu.
review.name: Versatile Luxurious Winter Wonder Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Equipe R Habu S9 Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really like this jacket.  When paired with an Assos base layer and mid layer, I’ve ridden this easily into 30s.  I haven’t confirmed yet but expect I can get into the 20s if using the (separate LS mid-layer).  My only complaint is that the sleeves are on the baggy side.
review.name: Almost Perfect

name: Equipe R Habu S9 Winter Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Swift Lite  Printed 2.5in Shorts - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the print of the Lavender Squiggle - a shout out to the 90s seamless geometric patterns that's easy to wear and fun to look at. While cute and comfortable, the Swift Lite shorts have a strange fit. Too fitted to be classic track shorts, but not fitted enough for a leg day at the gym. The Swift Lite shorts had a rough time on the trails, and struggled to stand up to any close-knit technical terrain with rocks or branches. OR's soft fabric choice is comfortable but prone to snagging, so not the best choice for any route with close quarters.
review.name: Cute, but unimpressive

name: Swift Lite  Printed 2.5in Shorts - Women's
