review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Replaced a Muck Chore with these. I found the fit different as the Muck Boot rattled on my foot the Bog actually fits my foot and hugs it. When I first put the left boot on I noticed a course feeling stitched seem down the inside front but with wear it has softened and no longed noticed. These are quite comfortable and I hope to find they will last for some years.
review.name: Good Fit

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very comfortable and durable. I wear them 6 days a week for 12 hours, no complaints!
review.name: As advertised

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the new Classic Seamless boots! I have been wearing them for several months for chores on our dairy farm. They are holding up really well and they are very comfortable I can wear them all day! Some Footwear will hurt my feet during breaking them in and these have felt great from day 1!
review.name: Comfortable and very durable

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted boots to just step into to take the dogs out or use the grill in the snow. I ordered a size larger for ease of slipping on. They are waterproof and warm (even with bare feet at times) and exactly what I wanted. I plan to wear them with heavy socks for snow blowing. They are sturdy and nonslip. I made the right choice.
review.name: WATERPROOF AND WARM

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Boots fit nice and snug. The sole and insert are very comfortable. The boots are easy to spray down after getting dirty.
review.name: Comfortable and Warm

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots scream high quality the moment you open the box. I bought these specifically for Wisconsin winters (snowblowing, family walks after a big snowfall). Not only are they comfortable, but I know my feet will stay dry and warm in even the harshest winter conditions. Great boot!
review.name: Quality, Durable, Dependable

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love them so far. They're lighter and way more flexible. Flipping them on and off is just 10 times easier. They just hug to your feet and don't go anywhere. It's a really good heel cup, so no sliding around. In other boots, my heel would move. They were easy on and off but then my heel would move and I would get a hot spot or blisters. I can wear my BOGS all day, every day. Even when it's dry out. I have problems with my sciatic nerves and I can tell when I have boots on that don't support it, it flares up. I haven't had any issues with the BOGS. I will buy another pair 100%.
review.name: Best boots for all-day wear

review.itemreviewed: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is an easy boot to recommend. Flexible, durable, comfortable, and a cinch to slip on and off. This boot is right at home doing farm chores, on horseback, or running errands. What's not to love?
review.name: Perfect for Farm Work

name: Classic II Tall Seamless Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Juno H2O 30L Plus Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Juno H2O 30L Plus Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Juno H2O 30L Plus Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love that companies have started making extended fit sizes. I have another daypack that doesn’t feel that great because it’s a lot smaller. This one has a comfortable hip belt and the shoulder straps are longer than standard packs and don’t dig into my armpits. There’s enough space for both shorter and longer hikes, and different kinds of weather.

I've been hiking with all kinds of different packs over the years, but none have compared to this Gregory Juno 30 H2O Plus size. I have broad shoulders, 5' 7" wear a 38/40 G cup, XL- 1X tops and bottoms with plenty of hips... I'm usually partial to "men's packs" since the shoulder straps are slightly wider, but they still never fit right especially in the bust and armpits, if there's a hip belt it is usually extremely tight. I tried this beauty on and was literally jumping up and down because it fit MY BODY so well! (not to mention how comfortable it is and moves with you!) This pack is amazing all around (I bought the June 24 H2O for my mom who is straight sized) the airflow is amazing on the back, the padding is so nice and with the hipbelt/fins that actually fit with huge easy access pockets... WOW the water reservoir is great and I love the magnetic easy access on the chest strap. The sunnies strap is great, and I love that there's a dedicated spot for my trekking poles. The compartments are huge and I can even fit all of my camera equipment plus snacks or I can load up for a quick overnight. The only Itty-bitty complaint is it doesn't come with a rain over but that's an easy fix. Thanks Gregory for a great pack that fits those of us with curves!
review.name: Perfection for the curves

review.reviewBody:
After putting on some pandemic weight, my Osprey packs barely fit, we’re rubbing me under my arms, and the hipbelt pockets basically became buttbelt pockets. When I discovered the Gregory plus packs, I was overjoyed and my experience with this Juno 30 pack has been amazing so far. 

I really appreciate how Gregory has worked hard to not just offer a longer belt strap like t some other brands do and call it a day. Instead, I feel like this pack is really made to fit plus size bodies. I’m still not used to being able to reach vertically down into my hip belt pockets and constantly find myself reaching behind, but it’s a positive change that I’m getting used to. Also, I love how stable the pack feels on my hips. 

My only gripe is that I wish the shoulder straps were slightly less wide. Yes, the padding is lovely, but they rub slightly against the front of my upper arms when I’m striding with trekking poles.

Overall, it’s still a really great pack that I use all the time. I also recently purchased the Kalmia 60 (not from this website, alas) and I hope that Gregory puts out more plus packs soon. Representation is everything and while us plus folks are finally getting a little love, it’d be awesome to get as much as the rest. 👍
review.name: Awesome pack with just one complaint…

review.reviewBody:
I loved everything about this pack except the frame. With many trials I could not get the weight distributed right AND not have the corners of the frame digs in right below my si joint area. Curious if it's a short people problem as I'm 5'2.
Seems high quality, good overall pocket arrangement, hip pockets I can get to (!!), cinches down for small loads or can be stuffed to the max. Good carry-on size too.
I'm returning it and hoping they make the same thing without a frame. I'd buy it in a heartbeat, despite the sticker shock.
review.name: Wanted to love it, but frame digs into body

review.reviewBody: I don’t like the Juno style regular or plus size. Feels cheaply made compared to the other styles. I wish the extended hip belt was retractable like my kalmia and katmia plus size packs I have. I’ve been losing weight so the hip belt on the Juno would be too big eventually and then I wouldn’t be able to tighten it down properly. I returned for a men’s Zulu 30.
review.name: Hip belt not retractable like other plus size pack

review.reviewBody: This beautiful, large daypack is AMAZING!!  Fits perfectly with its many adjustment straps.  And BY FAR the most comfortable pack I have ever worn, carrying 15 to 18 lbs of back country day-hiking gear and, mostly, water.  If you're a larger person, give it a whirl.  You'll be glad you did!
review.name: Large-sized Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Overall: this is a great daypack!! 
Pros: The water bladder sits in its own pocket, which is awesome because it doesn't interfere with space in the rest of the pack. The regular compartment includes tons of space that can hold the 10 essentials. There is a pocket with a zipper that can hold keys and other small items you don't want to get lost. I just feel like I'm also finding little spots to stash stuff and I love it! Super comfy straps and it's become my everyday pack!
Cons:
review.name: Incredibly comfortable daypack

review.reviewBody: I love my new backpack! I am so happy with the fit. It is excellent that Gregory has sizes to fit everyone!
review.name: LOVE it!

review.reviewBody: Just got my new backpack, it is confortable, strong and beautiful!! Love it!!
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody: Love this plus sized pack. It's such an amazing feeling to finally have a hip belt that sits properly and distributes the weight, with pockets I can reach! The mesh back panel keeps me cool on long hikes. Lots of useful pockets. Tried is it this weekend on a 17 mile hike and super happy with it
review.name: Yay for plus size

name: Juno H2O 30L Plus Backpack - Women's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Camp Tough Duffel 80L online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Tough Duffel 80L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Camp Tough Duffel 80L online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just got 2 of these in each color for wife and I (we're notorious gear twins) ahead of a road trip and already the best camp/travel bags we own (of many). The material is tough, the construction is diesel and utilitarian for swinging around. TONS of pockets/organizational features makes keeping bags organized and gear easy to locate. An unmentioned perk of this is the squat, wide profile compared to other gear bag options. Pull the whole bag out of the car, open her up and everything is easy to find because there's little need to stack things up (think wide cheeseburger vs. tall; what's going to be easier to eat??). Additionally, the wide, squat shape means these bags can stack on top of each other easily without sliding around too much, making car packing even more efficient and satisfying for my tetris brain.
review.name: Best camp/travel duffel for a tetris brain

review.reviewBody: One of my new favorite bags for long trips particularly in a car. The thought behind the organization is really nice with ample options on the outside. I love the collapsable internal storage option as well. Its great for camping packing or just a place to put my Childs stuff, in a more organized way.
review.name: Favorite Organized Duffel

name: Camp Tough Duffel 80L

review.itemreviewed: North Table Down Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I needed a sleek rain jacket, this one is working! The insert jacket is quite fluffy, I haven't used that yet. I'll test it out this winter.
review.name: The jacket looks and works great

review.itemreviewed: North Table Down Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is a great jacket, the inner piece is not as puffy as I was expecting, but it's definitly warm, so that's good, and it has some nice inner pockets if you need to keep some stuff safer and dry.
It's heavier than I was expecting, but it's pretty nice.
One thing I really like, compared with other North Face jackets I own, is that for the external piece, it doesn't use like a plastic layer inside to make it waterproof, because, in my experience, overtime, that layer will start pealing and it ruins the jacket, while in this case, the fabric itself is great at keeping you dry.
The only thing I whish it was different, is that the main zipper is exposed, so, water might get inside, I haven't had that problem yet, but I can imagine some heavy rain getting some water inside.
review.name: Great jacket

name: North Table Down Triclimate Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Reserve 30 HD Alloy 29in DT 350 Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 30 HD Alloy 29in DT 350 Boost Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Reserve 30 HD Alloy 29in DT 350 Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: What else is there not to love! Reserve wheels have an industry leading lifetime warranty. Bombproof DT Swiss 350 hubs and 32 spoke, 30mm internal width wheels are confidence inspiring. Been able to attack downhills and tech more aggressively knowing I have the lifetime warranty behind the wheelset. Only thing I would suggest is upgrade to 54T engagement if you’re coming off any wheels before with high engagement. If you have XD driver, I would up to the new 90T engagement hubs.
review.name: Great wheels w/ lifetime warranty

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these wheels for my SB160 after the stock Raceface arc rims were dented to oblivion on their second ride. The reserve alloy wheels came perfectly true with even spoke tension. I appreciate them including the Fillmore valves with the wheelset as well. 

With a lifetime warranty and great ride feel, these are now my go-to "budget" enduro wheels.
review.name: Currently loving these wheels

name: 30 HD Alloy 29in DT 350 Boost Wheelset

review.reviewBody:
Here’s an edited version of your review for clarity and flow:

“Excellent jacket! I love everything about it—the look, fit, and its resistance to water, wind, and cold temperatures. I’ve worn it while running in 38°F rain in Seattle, and it performed perfectly. I’m 5’10” and 167 lbs, and the US Medium fits me perfectly.
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: The jacket is wonderful. Super functional. While riding, it is quite comfortable and provides a lot of comfort.
review.name: Wonderful jacket. Working super nice

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'1".  Bought the red/black one, in XXL.  I normally wear XL.  But this jacket is super tight all around, including chest and around the biceps..  It is also super short, not coming quite to the waist.  I expect it would constantly ride up while being used.  The color is also off.  Not really red like in the phone, but more of a wash-out orange.  Not very attractive.   An additional star because the workmanship does look quite good.  But it is way smaller than the sizing in every dimension - width, length, and sleeve circumference.

Definitely sending it back.
review.name: Small all around, and not great color

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is warmer than I thought it would be.  For windy days in the 40 degree area, I just pair it up with a Castelli Flanders wool base layer.  If I match it up with anything warmer, it  just keeps you too warm.  It does lock in sweat on your chest.  The back has a section that is breathable.
I also found mine to run large.  I bought an XL U.S. thinking that I might have to layer it up so I should have gotten a L, but it is still ok.  sleeves will fit 35inch sleeve lengths.  
Jacket is lightweight, warm, stops wind.  The only negative is that when I wear it, it makes a lot of wind noise.  
I think this would be good all the way down in the 30 degree temps.
Looks like excellent quality.  I wish it had zippered side vents to air out the chest area a bit.
review.name: It is warm!

review.reviewBody:
The jacket looks great, better than previous year's versions.  I had to return though and take the hit on postage for ordering too small.  Read the sizing carefully - I just looked at the end of the sizing details and chose L not realizing that was just the EU size and the US size for the jacket was actually M.

I checked back at the previous year's model I had bought and the EU L was equivalent to US L so last year's jacket was a perfect fit.  This year's version is too tight.  Unfortunately the next size up wasn't available in the color I wanted.
review.name: Careful with size when ordering

review.reviewBody: This is my second gore tex phantom. The first one seems to have more gore tex material so I think it's a little bit more protective ,this new one is more comfortable specially on the arms. I have ridden in 30 F weather and the jacket is doing a great job keeping you comfortable
review.name: Comfortable Jacket

name: Phantom GORE-TEX INFINIUM Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Mortirolo Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good cold weather gloves.  Wish you could use phone or computer with them.  They do run a little small.  My hand measurement is 9 inches so I ordered size large which was 9 1/2 inches and they are tight.  No way they would fit if my hand was any larger.
review.name: Nice gloves

review.reviewBody: If the zipper didn't bust, these would be a really good glove.
review.name: Zipper busted

review.reviewBody:
The fit is great. I like the zipper thing. Great feel and grip on the bars. But they don't keep my hands warm. 

I tested on a ride in the low 40s with this glove on one hand and a much lighter glove on the other. I couldn't feel the difference, both hands were equally cold. I guess you'd be ok wearing them in the upper 40s or low 50s but at that point you might as well wear a thinner, less expensive glove.
review.name: Don't keep hands warm, otherwise great.

review.reviewBody: A nicely made glove even with a challenging zipper.  You can get used to after enough practice time so no worries.  The missing element is not being able to use your devices.  These would be great if you didn't have to take the glove off to confirm your location when out exploring new areas.  Don't know why that was omitted in the world of tech we live in today and especially at this price point.  True to size and agree with the suggested temps.  If you have a liner glove, that can give you an extra 5-10 degrees to work with.  I've had many rides where this fell into the suggested temps but had to opt for my back up when exploring rides.  In short, if you are familiar with where you are, don't take photos, or ride tech free, this is the glove for you for the suggest temp. I found these on sale, but wouldn't buy them again.
review.name: Missing a key element

review.reviewBody:
Update:
The gloves don't interact well with an iPhone touch screen and garmin screen. I have to lick my finger for it to work
The zipper is a bit hard to operate. I wish they have used a bigger one. But I guess you don't need to use. 
Gloves are soft and it is easy to handle hoods.
review.name: Over all great, warm gloves but...

review.reviewBody: The rest is aweeesome , fits great, I have used this gloves in rides into the high 30's I do run very hot. this have done great. I have gotten cold only when I sweat a little too much and at the end of the ride gets cooler. The grip is superb. I used them once a week since January.  Not a cold weather glove for most people. However, excellent for spring, fall  and some winter.
review.name: Not a fan of the zipper

review.reviewBody: Bought a M, 'cause I wear a medium in about everything, and the fit is great. I have worn these into the low 40's, Anything below 45, and I begin to get uncomfortable. Though that is exactly as advertised, I expected better cold weather performance. I think some warmer blooded people will be fine a lower temps.  They are well made and comfortable.  I definitely recommend for the advertised purpose.
review.name: As advertised

review.reviewBody:
Pros:  great feel, keeps wind at bay; warm for cool weather

Cons:  runs small, zipper can be difficult to unzip which was supposed to be a key selling point.  Probably not the best for cold weather
review.name: Good for Cool Weather

name: Mortirolo Glove - Men's

hasVariant.name: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very Comfortable but run a bit small. Put these away last winter after cleaning them — Opened them this season and they are somewhat discolored — hard to clean.
review.name: Good for a season
comment: Hello Bonnief, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these! I got them last year for Christmas and live in Northern Minnesota. It's been very cold lately and these have been great for walking. I'll wear wool socks with them, walk 3 miles, and my feet don't get cold at all. They did take some getting used to as far as breaking in, but have been very comfortable.
review.name: Great Boots

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Best shoe-boots ever!. I purchased these for a winter trip to Europe since they are both warm and waterproof. Exceedingly comfortable,  like wearing a sherpa slipper all day with the traction of a mountain boot. They are seriously the best Sorels ever. They are very fashionable and the zipper access means never having untied shoes in the snow. Perfection!
review.name: Perfection

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for the 2023 winter season. LOVED them so much I wore them several times per week, and even made them my go-to for snow-related play. They are stylish, warm and easy to put on and take off. They are as practical for running to the bus stop as they are for pulling a sled up a hill between trips. Then I put them away for the summer. I stored them carefully in a box on a shelf in my closet. Imagine my horror when I pulled them out for use this year only to discover that the boot material is now off-color; the soles are whiter than the upholstery. These now look as wrong as yellow snow. Since I paid full price, which I justified due to the superior construction of this brand, I had hoped to wear them for at least two seasons.
review.name: LOVE(d)! But buyer beware ...
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot is not water proof at all - despite it being sold as being so
review.name: Not water proof

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Initially ordered the orange colour one size 5 - it was a bit snug but have returned because it looked like it was already used it had dirt underneath and a stain mark on top then re ordered the green one in size 5,5 it fits perfectly however the stitches where the zip inserted is puckered not as good as it looks online.
review.name: Love the styling but not the quality

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wore these boots every day on my cruise in Norway and in England! They were perfect!!!  No foot pain, great for hiking, and waterproof! Highly recommend!!
review.name: Perfect for every day and travel!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Bought with high expectations ahead of a snowboarding trip. EVERTREAD offered absolutely no traction, whether this was fresh powder, slush or compacted snow. Having read reviews and the sales pitch I did not pack other footwear and had to default to my snowboarding boots. Feel a bit cheated having wasted money on a fab looking pair of useless boots! But they did keep my feet warm!
If buying go up a half size to compensate this will allow socks to be worn.
review.name: Not for the snow

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super stylish. Unfortunately ran a little small for me. Typically I wear a 81/2 - 9 these still were requiring a 9 1/2.
review.name: Super cute

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: A little higher than preferred for a snow boot. Comfortable though.
review.name: Nice boot but higher than looks
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

name: Kinetic Impact Puffy Zip WP Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: XT/Ultegra CN-HG701 11-Speed Chain
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XT/Ultegra CN-HG701 11-Speed Chain online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy install, light weight, smooth shifting and easy to clean and lube!
review.name: Best Chain for your BUCK$

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought this chain.  My bike mechanic tried to install it but it was very floppy and not shifting properly on Shimano 11 speed Ultegra gears.  He discovered it may not be authentic. 

I then bought a new Ultegra 11 speed Shimano chain from the mechanic and it worked great.   Beware....this chain may not be authentic.
review.name: Chain was a possible fake
comment: I'm sorry to hear about your experience with the chain. Please know that we only order directly from authorized Shimano distributors to ensure the authenticity of our products. I've emailed you to address your concerns and discuss this further. Thank you for your feedback.

review.reviewBody: Perfect replacement of my old Ultegra 11 speed chain. The quick link made installation super easy, and there were more links on the main chain than my last replacement. No concern about getting the sizing right, though the cut excess feels wasteful.
review.name: It just works

review.reviewBody: You can’t beat this chain, for the price and quality. Compare to the Dura-Ace it last longer and is not much heavier, it came with the quick link. With good maintenance it run for more than 2000 miles
review.name: Best overall

review.reviewBody: This was essential a 1 for 1 Shimano replacement on a 2x11 Trek Fuel. The OEM version held up well with this a slight up grade with the quick link.
review.name: Great Chain

name: XT/Ultegra CN-HG701 11-Speed Chain

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: This layer wicks away moisture fast, which is what I look for in any winter weather gear. I sweat a lot even in the winter, but this keeps me warm on even long rides. By far the most comfortable and warmest baselayer I've owned to date. And the mesh design at the armpits is the icing on the cake.
review.name: Does not disappoint

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Based on the name and temperature rating for base layer I was expecting a much heavier fabric when I ordered it.  Much to my surprise, it's very thin.  This doesn't mean it's not warm though!  I have been super impressed with how well this piece provides warmth while still shedding excess heat and keeping me dry.  Bust out a strong sweat on a climb and it wicks the moisture away instantly keeping you warm on the descent.  I've worn it between 20F and 50F and, with adequate ventilation, it is perfect every time.  I'm 6' and 165 (15 1/2 x 34 shirt) and the medium is a snug fit all around with good sleeve and body length.  Probably not a great fit if you're on the bigger side.
review.name: Heavyweight Warmth in a Lightweight Base

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a warm and comfortable first layer that fits snug (as is should), provides excellent thermal insulation, and is just the right amount of wicking and mesh vents to regulate body temp during different levels of intensity. I wear this under a mid-layer jersey and jacket top layer for 30- deg F, or 30+F during brisk rides with just a Castelli ROS jacket and no mid layer. The neck is warm and I like the adjustable length. This is an essential piece for cold weather riding. Castelli got it right. I am a men's size small in all Castelli wear, which makes up most of my riding kit throughout the year. This Flanders base layer fits me perfectly.
review.name: Perfect first layer for cold weather

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Castelli has done it again.  I never tire of Castelli impressing me with their innovations.  The Flanders Warmer is phenomenal kit for those who ride throughout the year and who often find themselves in very chilly climates.  What impresses me maybe the most is that Castelli has figured out how to make their polyester base layers as functional as wool. I wear a lot of wool and have always been impressed by its unique ability to wick sweat and keep the body warm even when wet.  The Flanders poly top does the same and adds a wonderful turtle neck which adds another level of warmth which was quite unexpected.  As with most Castelli items, I sized-up to an XXL from my normal size of XL.  Buy with confidence. This item will become a favorite.
review.name: Castelli Flanders Neck Warmer

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I was reluctant to purchase this base layer due to the other reviews saying it fit very small, but I rolled the dice anyway and bought it. Backcountry?s customer service is so good and fast, I knew if I needed to exchange it, it wouldn?t be a problem. 

Fit was true to Castelli?s sizing and fit just like the many other Castelli base layers, jerseys, and jackets I have in size medium. 

Quality was up to par for Castelli gear and it was perfect for keeping me nice and warm. I liked the fact that you can unfold the turtleneck and pull it over your chin/mouth if you needed. 

I definitely recommend it!
review.name: Pleasantly surprised!

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have some bibs, jacket, jersey by Castelli and am usually an XL (bit under 6', 41" chest and 180ish lbs depending on the season). Looks and feels like a great base layer but wow even small by Castelli standards. Could barely get it over my head and the neck is suuupper tight. I have muscular forearms, biceps and shoulders. I'm basically shrink wrapped to the point of uncomfortable.
review.name: Well made, but smaller than normal

review.itemreviewed: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality base layer for cycling. Extremely warm and ventilated in all the right spots. Make sure you size up in all the top layers made by Castelli.  I own base layers from most of the top companies, and Castelli's quality and features are superior. It is cut short in the front like a cycling jersey, so do not buy for snow mountain related sports. I wish I was able to find ski base layers of this quality.
review.name: Great Base Layer / Cut like Jersey

name: Flanders Warm Neck Warmer Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: We take this with us camping everywhere!  It packs up small and is remarkably warm for how lightweight it is.  Of course, it doesn’t compare to the warmth of down.  We have washed it, and it came out perfect!  We just love it!
review.name: Fantastic little blanket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and comfortable. My only complaint is it came out of the box(bag) with loose threads/ stitching  which is very unfortunate when you spend this kind of money on something. Concerned about the durability and lifespan if it’s already coming apart. I would like to be able to recommend this quilt but with the quality issue, I can’t say I do. Probably better off spending a little more money for the quality.
review.name: Came with loose threads/ stitching

review.reviewBody:
I have had this blanket for over a year now and wanted to say that it is one of the best purchases I have made. This thing goes with me everywhere. Super warm, super easy to pack, and not to mention the perfect size. 
I do not recommend washing this blanket,  I don't know how it will hold up in the wash. But I let it air out and it has been fine!
review.name: The best blanket

name: Basecamp Double Bivy Quilt

description: Buy the Castelli Unlimited Cargo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Unlimited Cargo Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Unlimited Cargo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
TLDR: Bibs are great, Backcountry's service...? 
I bought this for a gift for a family member, and he is very happy with the bibs. (I am wearing the women's version on the trainer as I type this, and can say they're great! Similar quality chamois to other Castelli items. Has held up for over a year of regular use - look brand new still.) My gripe is that the package was lost and Backcountry/Competitive Cyclist wasn't able to send another pair or even send a similar item. I ordered these elsewhere.
review.name: Great bibs!

review.reviewBody: I wear a medium, and these are way too small. I'm 5'8" 170 pounds.
review.name: Run really small

review.reviewBody: Bought these a few months ago with the idea of wearing on my longer "adventure" rides, which I do on a gravel bike and can involve pavement, gravel, single track, etc. They are just as comfortable as my road bibs from the same brand and fit similarly but are made from a more durable material that gives me more confidence if I end up with any bushwhacking. There is a pocket in the small of the back which ends up under your jersey so is good for things you want to keep secure and out of the elements but don't need to access regularly (e.g. car keys).  There are also two pockets on the outside of the thighs, which lay flat when not used but expand substantially to hold gear. While you can fit something like a phone, I found it better for lighter objects like gels, gloves, etc. only because I don't like the feeling of weight on my legs as I pedal. I'll probably just start buying these instead of dedicated road bibs since they are so versatile, but I'm sure I'll get some flack on group rides from the roadie purists for having pockets!
review.name: Unobtrusive but functional pockets

name: Unlimited Cargo Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Exped Down Pillow online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Down Pillow
hasVariant.description: Buy the Exped Down Pillow online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this pillow to travel with while on a 3 month backpacking trip through Ecuador. So glad I did I used it on the plane ,busses , hostels and camping.  It's very comfortable and  you can adjust it's firmness very easily.  Is small lightweight and very pacable. Love it
review.name: Awesome travel pillow

review.reviewBody:
Took this along on my recent trek on the Laugavegur Trail. It's still an air pillow, however, my start of day without a sore neck or shoulders before putting a pack on? Absolutely worth any small amount of extra weight that this added to the pack compared to the old stuff sack full of clothes that I was used to. 

There's no going back for me - this is going with me on any trek. Might even bring it with me if I'm doing a sleep over somewhere and don't know if the pillows there are going to cut it ;) (I may be kidding, but I'm not sure, this thing is comfy!).
review.name: Just the thing

review.reviewBody: Of the 5 different air pillows I tried out, this one is my favorite! The amount of 'plush' is great and the material used is soft on my face! The air bag pulls out so you can wash the cover. It does have to be handwashed which is a hassle. It is definitely not my down pillow but it packs up smaller!
review.name: It's not a down pillow but. . .

name: Down Pillow
Down Pillow

review.itemreviewed: Vento Ferox Carbon Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody:
These things are incredible. I have narrow, flat, low volume, bony feet, and I need a stiff sole to prevent hot spots on long rides. I often run into the issue of the top of a shoe upper bowing up when I tighten a shoe down to the level I need, but this upper is so low-profile and the last is so narrow that the upper actually lays nice and flat on the top of my forefoot. I love having the velcro strap at the ankle for security's sake (I love BOA and the adjustable fit it provides but busting a dial 20 miles from civilization isn't fun if it's what is keeping the shoe on your foot. The upper velcro strap takes care of that concern and is still an easily and quickly adjustable closure). Little silicone grippers in the back of the narrow heel pocket so absolutely zero heel slip. This shoe is extremely light, stiff, and straddles the line between breathable and weatherproof. I run these with my Crank Bros Candy pedals and have one of the spacers between the cleat and the sole plate. Little bit of clicky-clacky off the bike but great spacing on the pedal for easy controlled float. Disclaimer: This is not the shoe for someone who has a wide, high volume foot, and wants a flexible sole for walkability. This is a race-oriented, narrow, stiff, low volume shoe that rewards you when you put the power down or spend all day in the saddle. Plays nice with custom/box insoles too.

Reach out if you are interested in this or any other Fizik model and I or another Gearhead would love to help you out! Sizing guide is very reliable, and typically runs true to size, but I do run a half size smaller in Fizik compared to a lot of other brands. I wear a 11/11.5 US Men's street shoe and a 45 in all Fizik shoes.

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: The Best Gravel Shoe For Me

review.itemreviewed: Vento Ferox Carbon Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody:
I’ve been riding this shoe on gravel rides for the last few months. After around 400 miles I can say that I love them. 
Out of the box, great quality. Light, secure closures without any heel slip. The sole is plenty stiff but the soft rubber lugs make them very walkable. Overall very comfortable and fit is right on. 
My only complaint is the poor color options of lavender or black. Not really a lavender guy, and the black really heats up in the Arizona sun
review.name: Great Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Vento Ferox Carbon Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody: These light weight shoes are very comfortable and slim for my narrow low volume foot. Very easy to put on, take off with the velcro cincher and BOA system. My only negative is that after installing my cleat, I couldn’t clip into the SPD pedal. I had to purchase an after market ‘lift’ to place under the cleat. And dremel off some of the side rubber material to clip in. The cleat drags on the ground when walking. A bit of a design flaw.
review.name: Easy on off shoe

review.itemreviewed: Vento Ferox Carbon Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody: I got these shoes last year because I needed a new Gravel shoe. They are awesome. I am typically a Women's 8.5 or 9 in regular shoes, and I got the size 40. I was surprised at how well these fit. I love the BOA and the Velcro Powerstrap, so I can dial the fit in perfectly. I went with the Lilac color and it is so cool. I always get compliments and the upper is super durable.
review.name: Great Gravel shoe!

name: Vento Ferox Carbon Mountain Bike Shoe

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aether 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aether 65L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aether 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Other than the rain cover, it’s a great bag. I used it for the first time doing the presidential traverse in the White Mountains and it performed great. It’s easy to load and unload. It has great compression. It was very comfortable with 30-35lbs in it for a day of hiking. 

The only negative is the rain cover that came with it did not stay on in high winds. It doesn’t have anything built in that holds it to the bag and it relies totally on the elastic draw string. There were 60 mph winds one day and it just blew off. Thankfully I had clipped it in with a carabiner, but otherwise it would have been gone down the gulf and I would have had a very wet bag. My wife has an Osprey Aura AG 65 that has a rain cover with two slots for fitting the hip belt through and her rain cover stayed in place perfectly the whole time. I know I could just buy a better rain cover, but this seems like a miss from Osprey on such an expensive bag.
review.name: Great but the rain cover is useless in wind

review.reviewBody:
At 5lbs starting weight, this is not a pack for ultralight hikers.   I have loaded it down for 40lbs and it really started to hurt my shoulders.  I had to continuously adjust it while hiking, and no matter what I did it just keep hurting my shoulder and made it very uncomfortable.   I really wanted to like this pack but It didn't work for me.  

Bag is very well built.  The airscape back is a nice touch and having a internal bladder is always nice.  Lots of storage spaces for everything.   Overall its a good bag if it works for you!
review.name: Good Pack, but heavy starting weight

review.reviewBody: My torso is 17" so I purchased the S/M size expecting it to be on the shortest setting. I found I needed to have it just under the longest setting to fit me correctly with the middle of the hip belt on my iliac crest. I think you might be able to squeeze into this pack if your torso is 19" maximum. Easily the most comfortable pack I have tried on, very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Size and Fit

review.reviewBody: This pack has every feature one would want in a pack except for a MAJOR design flaw. It has 2 friction points on the back adjustment system which rub on my back and leave me with two red chaffing marks and bruises after every long hike with heavier loads (40-45lbs). I originally bought this for mountaineering and it was perfect because I was wearing so many layers due to cold weather. Now that I'm using it in warm weather without the extra layers on my upper body, I have found that the 2 adjustment strap connection points rub on my back and have removed the skin and caused painful bruising. I have adjusted the pack a number of times to see if it would help but have found that nothing works. I own numerous packs for every possible situation and although I love the features of this pack it is simply too painful to use in warmer weather when I am not wearing extra layers to provide some protection for my back. I hate to say it because I love the features but coming from someone that wears a pack at least 3 out of 7 days every week, I would NOT recommend this pack. There are many other brands with different designs that do not have this issue.
review.name: Great features but TERRIBLE for long days with Heavier loads

review.reviewBody: I first purchased this pack in fall of 2015, and have used it on every backpacking trip I've been on since Including working as a backpacking guide for the entire summer season. This pack without question is built to last. The on the go adjustments are easy and simple. Depending on the challenge and group size for your next adventure, This pack can easily handle up to 5 days worth of food and supplies. The only maintenance I have done in 5 years is replace the hip belt because I outgrew the original one that came with it.
review.name: Built for Life

review.reviewBody: I have put this pack through the ringer and I absolutely love using it on longer trips that require a heavier load. I also own the previous version that has the anti-gravity suspension system and plan to have both for a very long time. This pack is using an AirScape back panel instead, which is not as functional as the AG system but still has a nice breathable foam and mesh that keeps you cool in hotter temperatures. The material is very durable and meant to last but is a bit heavy at 5lbs and 1.9ozs. Osprey has been around for a bit now and I feel like they have really honed in long-term comfort with the amount of adjustability they give you on this pack. Also, lots of attachment points for your dog mat, trekking poles, ice axes, etc. In addition, if you are like me and like to get to camp early, then hike around after some lunch, the detachable daypack comes in handy big time. You can bring the essentials and store your reservoir in it instead of carrying around a water bottle or bringing your entire pack.
review.name: Osprey Packs Aether 65L Backpack

name: Aether 65L Backpack
Aether 65L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: They seem to be great but was disappointed to find the stitching coming apart after the first wear. Already took the tags off so can’t return :(
review.name: Stitching failing after first use

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm completely and totally obsessed- these are my new favorite leggings (and definitely my favorite BY leggings). They're slightly more compressive than Caught in the Midi and Out of Pocket (they have similar compression as the Equipped leggings). I feel held in, and it might be in my head, but my low back/core feels supported in a way I haven't felt with other BY leggings. They're VERY high waisted, so nothing spills out- which I greatly appreciate. I find that they fit TTS. For reference, I'm 5'1", 130lbs- I'm a Medium in all BY leggings, and a Medium in this style fits me perfectly. I have an hourglass figure, and often have a hard time (in any brand) finding well fitting leggings that fit my larger butt and tinier waist. I was a little worried when I first tried these on because I had a little bit of a struggle getting them over my hips. But once they were up, they felt like leggings custom made for my body. Overall I've never felt better in leggings than I do in these. I'll definitely be ordering these in every color. A true home run for Beyond Yoga!
review.name: I've Never Felt Better in Leggings

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Amazingly soft fabric. Nice warm chocolate color. Glad took size recommendations to go one up.
review.name: Amazingly soft fabric. Nice warm

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are just ok. My first purchase from this brand. Probably my last.
review.name: Not the color I ordered and very tight

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the color and the fabric! Got them for indoor activities and they’ll be great in the warmer months. I got xs and they fit tight but still very comfortable. I’m 5’4 122 lbs.
review.name: Lightweight legging

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: The fit is very flattering. I love that you can make the waist tighter. They are so comfortable. I wear them working out and running errands. I usually wear a small but went with the medium because I had tried them on at a store and thought they ran small.
review.name: Favorite!

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: The channel for the drawstring is straight stitched, so it does not stretch like the rest of the legging. I could not get these over my hips! Poor construction!
review.name: Can’t get over hips

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are very well made and very comfortable - what I can't figure out is how people are saying these are true to size? I have a 24 inch waist and 37 inch hips, which according to the size chart should put me in an XXS or XS. I tried on a S that i could technically get on but felt like I was a sausage, and the mediums honestly feel slightly too small as well. What's happening with these? I might want a large or XL, even though I'm a size 0-2. What percentage of people can even wear these?
review.name: Comfy & Quality but TINY

review.itemreviewed: Spacedye Go Pocket Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: High quality soft fabric. Great fit and super flattering style!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Very happy with the Berkeley Crossbody so far. A friend had one in orange and it looked nicely weathered and loved, and seemed like such a practical "everything" bag. The bag is surprisingly spacious and that's great for cold weather because I can store a hat and gloves inside along with my normal tidbits. Can't wait to use it all season.

review.reviewBody: Very warm. Love that there are different layers so that I can use it for pretty much any temperature. It comes in a mesh bag but also has a stuff sack, which is nice so I can store it in the mesh bag but still be able to cram it into a smaller space if needed.
review.name: Great one bag

review.reviewBody: I love the multiple layers on this sleeping bag! It allows me to adjust the temperature based on the weather I'll be camping in. I would definitely recommend this bag.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: "One Bag" Performed flawlessly on the Allagash Wilderness Waterway in Maine. I am Registered Maine Guide, I recently guided a group of 8 clients through the Allagash. This was a 7 day canoe trip.We had a few nights of rain. One very rainy night my tent was in a super wet spot and some water came in. I stayed on my pad and the sleeping bag repelled surface water and stayed warm and dry. The other nights it was easy to regulate body temp using the various layers of the sleeping bag. I was never too hot or too cold. It packs small and the stuff bag makes a comfy pillow when turned inside out. I highly recommend this sleeping bag!
review.name: "One Bag" Works flawlessly in the Maine Allagash Wilderness

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought the one bag because I camp in many different temperatures. Second night got down to 35 degrees and I was wearing sweatpants sweatshirt and good socks. Absolutely freezing. The zippers go up both sides and grab material about 5 different times and would stop the zipper and I would have to fiddle with it to get it to work. I washed the bag when I got home and there is a spot that will not dry no matter what I do and there is a spot where there is no insulation at all!! I called northface and they were rude and not helpful. This bag was very expensive and underperformed big time
review.name: Northface quality has gone down!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am taking this Summer off to go rock climbing in quite a few Westarn State destinations. Mostly I plan to sleep in the back of my Subaru using a battery fan for air curculation. I expect to encounter a range of nighttime temps, from moderate to down around Freezing. I was intrigued by this bag and scooped it up. For what it is: 3 bags in one, the price is quite reasonable. I assure you it's comfy from the moment you crawl in. Is spacious with a footbox that's almost too roomy. I can see cramming a fleece top or jacket down there on a super cold night. My only caveat to you: Practice assembling and disassembling the bag before you take off. Once you get the hang of it, it's eezie peezie; but not necessarily the first time. Almost dinged it one star because it has a pair of little pad loops down near your feet, but no loops up around your shoulders. Thinking of taking it to my local Tailor and asking her to install a pair of loops. Other than that, a very unique and way-cuddly sleeping bag 4 sure.
review.name: Chosen To Deal With All Sorts Of Temps

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warmth & comfort are the 2 biggest factors for me when looking for a bag. If I'm going to add a small amount of extra weight to my pack I would for a warmer more comfortable bag. That being said the weight of this bag is not bad. I appreciate that is has a compression bag as well as a larger storage bag. I love the layered design saving me from bringing a bag liner or bivy for colder nights.
review.name: The Perfect Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice and comfortable sleeping bag for any season.
review.name: Great 3 in 1 sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My teenage son loves this bag for camping; it's so versatile.
review.name: Cool (and warm) product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I m using it to sleep inside my truck on the road, it is warmmmm and light weight
review.name: I would recommend this product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We are a family of 4, and we have 5 One Bags, 4 Individual and 1 Duo, and we absolutely love them! Don't listen to the bad reviews, I mean yes the zipper toggle could maybe be improved(most sleeping bag zippers need improvement) yes the zippers can snag on the material(Most zippers can and do snag if you don't zip it right) and yes for backpacking the entire system might be a bit heavy and bulky for some, but, the fact that in One bag you have all you need for most weather conditions and you have the ability to separate the bag for what weather you are expecting(If weight is an issue) makes this a great all in One system. Personally and collectively as a family, we all feel the One Bags are super comfortable, especially when you don't need the middle layer and you can unzip it and sleep on top of it, as it definitely adds to the comfort. Lastly, if you want an actual professional review(Sorry but giving 1-2 stars for common sleeping bag issues simply isn't fair), there are professional outdoor sites that have reviewed the One Bag, and the only negative they had to say about it was the overall weight which is to be expected for any all in one system. Oh, and to the 1 star review about 'Lying about the weight', big deal, you got some extra fill and you're going to complain about it? Woopty woo, you'd probably complain if it was lighter than listed as well, but you'd probably complain more about less fill than more fill, so either way you wouldn't be happy, also, who on earth weighs their sleeping bags and compares them to the listed weight, isn't that just going a bit too far?!
review.name: Absolutely Amazing Bags!!!

name: One Sleeping Bag: Down

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these - they look really sleek and like something I'd wear daily. But for my specific feet they are just too narrow in the toe box. They also are a lot more stiff and a lot less padded than the Sportiva TX3s I eventually purchased in the same size. Some reviews here said they are comfortable for hiking, but for me and my wide feet they just didn't seem like they would work.
review.name: Cute, but stiff and not wide enough

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size 9.  However, with this shoe, I had to go up to a 10.5.  Once I did that, they fit amazingly.  I wore them once on the treadmill before going out hiking.  Hiked 8, 10, and 14 miles in three straight days and had no issues whatsoever.  I love these shoes as they did repel the water (not waterproof) and they are relatively light.  And...I did not feel any of the rock edges we were hiking on.
review.name: Great hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: These are super comfortable right off the bat. They slip on like socks but  the soles are super sturdy. I've already worn them for miles and miles at a time and haven't gotten a blister. My only complaint is that the top part of the shoe (the laces) is pretty stretchy, so if you're actually going to be doing some rock climbing in these, jamming your foot in cracks, they're not super bomber feeling.
review.name: Super Comfy Right Off The Bat

review.reviewBody: These are my first ever approach shoe and I'm in love. I took them on the first spin in a slot canyon and they did better then my expectations. I also wore them on a walk in the rain, in the city and my feet didn't get wet, I was surprised. Cons- they don't stayed tied very well, and I don't like my shoes tight while I hike, so leaves me with no length in the laces to double knot. The "sock" like top part is kinda annoying. I would totally buy these again and recommend to friends. I'm typically a 9.5 or 10....glad I went to a 10, they fit perfectly.
review.name: I love these!

review.reviewBody: I loved these shoes right of the box, which is unusual for me. They stick great, and they are are a huge upgrade from my running shoes. The round laces don't stay tied, so make sure to double loop them. The biggest bummer is after only a week of approaches there are small holes on top of the toe box where the rubber meets the fabric. I did not climb in them, only hike, so hopefully they will continue the rubber further across and that will improve their durability.
review.name: Great fit and good friction

review.reviewBody: This is a well made shoe. These are great for colder climates or approaches that include water obstacles. In hot and humid conditions, they can get a little sweaty and more difficult to take on and off due to the "sock" lining at the ankle, but again, this is a great plus for colder weather.
review.name: Great moderate weather shoe

description: Buy the Blackburn Outpost Seat Pack & Dry Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Outpost Seat Pack & Dry Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Outpost Seat Pack & Dry Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It is immediately clear that this was designed by the same people who give you 8 rubber spacers and a flimsy piece of plastic as a mount for your bike light. Incredibly annoying to try and put on your bike. None of the straps are long enough if you have the bag really full. The bag is only attached to the "mount" by a single piece of velcro. You need to clamp two pieces of aluminum together on your saddle rails in order to put the mount on, but if your saddle has any setback,the clamp will not be flat on the rails, and seems as though it could easily damage any rails, even if they're not carbon. Don't buy this.
review.name: Horrendous

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag a few months ago and used it for a 4 day mountain bike trip. Our group did 25-45 miles of single track each day (maah daah hey trail was awesome). I kept all my clothes and sleeping gear in here and had no problem with space. I really liked being able to take out the dry bag both for packing and also setting up camp. It did make things just a bit easier. Only complaints were that the bag did swing quite a bit. It was less annoying than I would have expected. NOTE to shorter riders this bag does not have anything firm on the bottom and did bulge out a bit. I am pretty tall and run a tall seat so had no tire drag issues but others may struggle with this. Overall I really liked the bag and would recommend to anyone trying out bike packing.
review.name: Pretty great

name: Outpost Seat Pack & Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: Finally! Shorts at a decent price point. I like these for travel because they wash and dry easily. Also they are very cool in extremely hot environs like the Amazon River and Turkey in the summer.
review.name: BRAVO !

review.reviewBody: I've had these underwear for a bit and they are comfortable. For me they aren't great for outdoors or everyday. They're great for lounging around or sleeping.
review.name: They're ok.

review.reviewBody: Probably the best boxers I've owned.  Light, comfortable, and they dry quickly when washing.
review.name: These are Great

review.reviewBody: Best underwear I have had. Light, wicks well, cool, more comfortable than cotton.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I got these for a long trip - trying to take a minimal amount of clothes. These pack tight and wash easily - ready for the next day.
review.name: Boxers

review.reviewBody:
The product description is wrong. These are boxers not briefs. 

That being said, I own several of these (in the brief form), and they are my favorite for their fit, quality, breathability and reusability. I packed just two pairs on a nine-month trip and was very satisfied.
review.name: Boxers not briefs

review.reviewBody: These aren’t boxer briefs but boxers and they run way large.
review.name: Not as advertised

review.reviewBody: Great light weight boxers. I wear a 35 waist and bought the large which is 38-40. They fit but no way are they a 38
review.name: Great product, sizing is weird

review.reviewBody: I bought these for travel originally. Now they are my every day boxers.
review.name: Light, comfortable, quick drying.

review.reviewBody: I thought I was purchasing the boxer briefs. I was very sad to see that these are boxers. They are far too baggy for me.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots had so many 5 Star reviews and I was skeptical… I shouldn’t have been! Day one, they are so comfortable with or without socks, so cute, and so warm! Northern Wisconsin can be bitter cold and these are just what I needed! Love love love! Maybe I’ll treat myself to another pair in a different color for my birthday!
review.name: Better than expected! And I expected a lot!

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They fit well and true to size and very comfortable. Definitely waterproof and they keep the cold out well!
review.name: My new favourite shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are very comfy. They are perfect for cold temperatures. My legs are not getting tired since these boots are so lightweight. They are also very stylish.
review.name: Good boots

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the color and fit of these boots (got the gray)
review.name: Love the color and warmth

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this boot! 🥾 Super soft and comfy sole.  Wish the toe box was a smidge deeper for the big toes as well as wider on the outside for the pinky toe.  It tapers in on the outer edge.  I need to size up for it to work.  Hope sizing up won’t be too long especially for my smaller foot.
review.name: Soft Comfy Flexible But Slightly Narrow and Shallow Toe Box

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the best boots ever.  They are warm on your feet, waterproof and just all around comfortable.   I wore this on a day trip to NYC and walked 15 miles with no problems no sore feet.  I have 2 pairs.
review.name: BEST EVER

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just received my Green boots and they are beautiful.  I am a 8 1/2 Wide and hoped these would work.  They are a little tight with socks but know they will stretch so keeping them!  They are comfortable with no socks!  Can’t wait to wear them!
review.name: The best Green

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfy boot, more like a sneaker boot. The inside is cozy and warm.
review.name: Comfy boots

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear 7 1/2 but always buy 8.  There’s a little room, perfect for thicker socks.  They are comfortable.  I will be putting in a shoe insert, as they are pretty flat on the insole.
review.name: Fit and function

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love them!  They are so comfortable and perfect for fall/winter here in South Carolina. Especially for wet soccer games on the weekends!  These are so well made.  Awesome quality, very soft and super durable.  These will last for years to come.  I highly recommend!
review.name: Great quality!!

name: Sorel Explorer III Joan WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great daypack. It is super light and comfortable to wear. It's the perfect size for a day hike or a trail run. There's plenty of room for the essentials without any unneeded bulk. All the materials and construction feel very high quality and sturdy. Even though this is a small pack, it is one of the best made backpacks we've used (and we have quite the collection.)
review.name: well made and super comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What I really like about this bag was that is small but can really fit a bunch of things in it. I loved how it had a tiny pocket on top of the bag. The straps are wonderful and don't dig into my shoulders when in use, and the waist belt in the mid section helps when I am cycling to remain snug. I know that I get a lot of use out of this bag.
review.name: Little But Mighty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this lightweight backpack! It would be great for backpacking/hiking, but we mostly use it for travel our with our sons for camp. It's nice to have a smaller backpack for the kids and something that isn't as daunting as a large backpack that topples them over! Love the water bottle holder on the side too!
review.name: Great backpack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I took this bag to our local fourth of July festival where cookers and big bags were forbidden. There are 2 side pickets for drinks, a large compartment inside and a smaller zipper compartment on top by the handle for ease of putting keys or cellphone away swiftly and then easily retrievable. The bag is well made and attractive.
review.name: awesome lil bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This back pack is. Light and very comfortable. It is a simple , useful design and small enough for when you don’t want to lug a huge bag around. Lifetime warranty is a great bonus. I know I will get a lot of use out of this bag.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag so far, I’ve taken it on a few in/out day hikes and it’s been great. The straps are super comfortable and offer enough cushion to prevent chaffing on my neck and shoulders. The chest strap is wide enough and offers great stabilization. The bag interior is large enough to accommodate a water bladder system if you need to or just a few snacks and a good water canteen. Color scheme is great too!
review.name: Comfortable and convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using this for the past few adventures and love it.  Light weight and all the compartments and pockets are perfect.  If it does get wet very easy to wipe off and clean. I am getting another one for my son.
review.name: Best Backpack I have ever used.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice backpack .  It’s not huge but can fit a nice amount of things in it ,  it has a little pocket up top I didn’t realize until today lol . Also has emergency instructions and basic first aid survival stuff printed on the little bag part on the inside .  A drink pocket on each side and one divider inside the bag so 2 separate spaces . The straps are nice and feel like they will last a long time and it has the straps you can snap together around your back in the middle and on the lower part . The color is a beautiful grey turquoise and I love it , I have a matching eyeshadow and nail polish .  It’s been super handy
review.name: Great little pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight backpack. Not too many pockets to put things in but I think for a 5 hours of hiking this size of the backpack is suitable. The strap has a soft cushion so it's very comfortable to wear for a long hike. Have enough room to place energy bars, a minimal emergency kit, and a lightweight jacket. Easily fit 2 water of bottles on the side pockets. Highly recommend it!
review.name: High quality backpack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is so perfect. It is lightweight but still holds a lot. I like the side compression straps, it makes it easier to carry comfortably. You have plenty of storage and the adjustable straps make it fit good. The waist belt makes for a snug fit.
review.name: Nice backpack

name: Speed Lite 13L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Teravail Road Standard Schrader Tube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Maybe it's just on me missing something but my tire says its 700 x 32, the Teravail tube I got says that it's 700 x 28-35, and yet the diameter of the tube is way too big. There's no way that I can use this.

If I'm missing something on my end I'd love to retract this one star rating, but as it stands now I can't give anything else but one star.
review.name: Diameter too Big??

review.reviewBody: I'm one of those people who pinch pennies where it doesn't matter, so most of the tubes I use are of the "it's mostly round" variety.  For the extra pennies, I've gotta say these are definitely above what I typically use.  Might just keep spending the tiny bit extra for the uniformity, if nothing else.
review.name: One of the nicer tubes I've used

name: Road Standard Schrader Tube
